orig.arab: bismi al-ll_ahi ar-ra.hm_ani ar-ra.hiimi

trans.eng: In the Name of God, the Clement, the Merciful

orig.arab: al-.hamdu li-ll_ahi alladhii a.zhara al-wujuuda min al-`adami

trans.eng: Praise be to God Who hath made being to come forth from nothingness;

orig.arab: wa-raqama `alY law.hi al-insaani min asraari al-qidami

trans.eng: graven upon the tablet of man the secrets of preexistence;

orig.arab: wa-`alama-hu min al-bayaani maa laa-yu`lamu

trans.eng: taught him from the mysteries of divine utterance that which he knew not;

orig.arab: wa-ja`ala-hu kitaabaN mubiinaN li-man 'aamana wa astaslama

trans.eng: made him a Luminous Book unto those who believed and surrendered themselves;

orig.arab: wa-ashhada khalqa kulliN shay'iN fii h_adhaa az-zamaani al-mu.zlami a.s-.saylami

trans.eng: caused him to witness the creation of all things in this black and ruinous age,

orig.arab: wa-an.taqa-hu fii qu.tbi al-baqaa'i `alY al-la.hni al-badii`i

trans.eng: and to speak forth from the apex of eternity with a wondrous voice in the Excellent Temple:

orig.arab: fii al-haykali al-mukarramu layashhada al-kulla fii nafsi-hi bi-nafsi-hi fii maqaamiN tajalliyiN rabbi-hi

trans.eng: to the end that every man may testify, in himself, by himself, in the station of the Manifestation of his Lord,

orig.arab: bi-anna-hu laa-il_aha illaa huwa

trans.eng: that verily there is no God save Him,

orig.arab: wa-layu.sila al-kullu bi-dh_alika ilY dhurwaTi al-.haqaa'iqi

trans.eng: and that every man may thereby win his way to the summit of realities,

orig.arab: .hattY laa-yushaahida a.haduN shay'aN illaa wa qad yarY al-ll_aha fii-hi

trans.eng: until none shall contemplate anything whatsoever but that he shall see God therein.

orig.arab: wa-'u.sallY wa-'usallama `alY awwaliN ba.hriN tasha~`aba min ba.hri al-hawiiyah

trans.eng: And I praise and glorify the first sea which hath branched from the ocean of the Divine Essence,

orig.arab: wa-awwaliN .sub.hiN laa-.ha `an ufuqi al-a.hadiyyaTi

trans.eng: and the first morn which hath glowed from the Horizon of Oneness,

orig.arab: wa-awwaliN shamsiN ashraqat fii samaa'i al-azaliyyaTi

trans.eng: and the first sun which hath risen in the Heaven of Eternity,

orig.arab: wa-awwaliN naariN uwqadat min mi.sbaa.hi al-qidamiyyaTi fii mishkuuTi al-waa.hidiyyaTi

trans.eng: and the first fire which was lit from the Lamp of Preexistence in the lantern of singleness:

orig.arab: alladhii kaana a.hmadaN fii malakuuti al-`aalamiini

trans.eng: He who was ^a.hmad in the kingdom of the exalted ones,

orig.arab: wa-mu.hammadaN fii malaa'i al-muqarrabiini

trans.eng: and ^mu.hammad amongst the concourse of the near ones,

orig.arab: wa-ma.hmuudaN fii jabaruuti al-mukhli.siini

trans.eng: and ^ma.hmuud in the realm of the sincere ones.

arab.quote: wa-iyyaamaN tada`uu falahu al-asmaa'i al-.husnYi fii quluubi al-`aarifiini

trans.eng: \dots{} by whichsoever (name) ye will, invoke Him: He hath most excellent names in the hearts of those who know.

orig.arab: wa-`alY 'aali-hi wa-.sa.hbi-hi tasliimaN kathiiraN daa'imaN abadaN

trans.eng: And upon His household and companions be abundant and abiding and eternal peace!

orig.arab: wa ba`da qad sami`ta maaghannat warqaa'i al-`irfaanu `alY afnaaniN sidraTiN fuwaadika

trans.eng: Further, we have harkened to what the nightingale of knowledge sang on the boughs of the tree of thy being,

orig.arab: wa `arafta maagharradat .hamaamaTi al-iiqaanu `alY agh.saaniN shajaraTiN qalbika

trans.eng: and learned what the dove of certitude cried on the branches of the bower of thy heart.

orig.arab: ka-innii wajdatu ravaa'i.hi a.t-.tayiba min qamii.siN .hubbika

trans.eng: Methinks I verily inhaled the pure fragrances of the garment of thy love,

orig.arab: wa adrakta tamaami li-qaa'ika fii mulaa.hi.zaTiN kitaabika

trans.eng: and attained thy very meeting from perusing thy letter.

orig.arab: wa lammaa balaghta ishaaraatika fii fanaa'iki fii al-ll_ahi

trans.eng: And since I noted thy mention of thy death in God, and thy life through Him,

orig.arab: wa-baqaa'ika bi-hi wa-.hubbika a.hibbaa'i al-ll_ahi wa ma.zaahiriN asmaa'u-hi wa-ma.taali`iN .sifaati-hi

trans.eng: and thy love for the beloved of God and the Manifestations of His Names and the Dawning-Points of His Attributes

orig.arab: lidhaa adhkurulaka ishaaraati qudsiiyaTaN sha`sha`aaniiyiTaN min maraatibi al-jalaal

trans.eng: I therefore reveal unto thee sacred and resplendent tokens from the planes of glory,

orig.arab: litajdhibika ilY saa.haTi al-qudsi wa al-qurbi wa al-jamaal

trans.eng: to attract thee into the court of holiness and nearness and beauty,

orig.arab: wa tawa.salaka ilY maqaamiN laaturY fii al-wujuud illaa .tal`aTi .ha.draTi ma.hbuubika

trans.eng: and draw thee to a station wherein thou shalt see nothing in creation save the Face of thy Beloved One, the Honored,

orig.arab: wa lan tarY al-khalq illaa kayuwmiN lam yakun a.hadiN madhkuuraN

trans.eng: and behold all created things only as in the day wherein none hath a mention.

orig.arab: wa-hiya maaghanna bulbulu al-a.hadiyyaTu fii al-riyaa.di al-ghawthiyyihi

trans.eng: Of this hath the nightingale of oneness sung in the garden of ^ghuwthiiyyih.

orig.arab: qawla-hu wa-ta.zhara `alY law.hi qalbika

trans.eng: He saith: And there shall appear upon the tablet of thine heart

orig.arab: raqawma la.taa'ifi asraari ittaqaw al-ll_aha yu`alimukumu al-ll_ahu

trans.eng: a writing of the subtle mysteries of Fear God and God will give you knowledge;

orig.arab: wa-yatadhakkara .taa'iri ruu.hika .ha.zaa'iri al-qidami

trans.eng: and the bird of thy soul shall recall the holy sanctuaries of preexistence

orig.arab: wa-ya.tiira fii fa.daa'i faaslakii subuli rabbika dhulilaN bijanaa.hi al-shuwq

trans.eng: and soar on the wings of longing in the heaven of walk the beaten paths of thy Lord,

orig.arab: wa-tajtanii min athmaaru al-'uns fii basaatiin kulii min kulli ath-thamaraat

trans.eng: and gather the fruits of communion in the gardens of Then feed on every kind of fruit.

orig.arab: intahY wa-`amrii yaa .habiiba lawtadhuuqa h_adhihi ath-thamaraat

trans.eng: By My life, O friend, wert thou to taste of these fruits,

orig.arab: min kha.dri h_adhihi as-sunbulaati al-llatii nabatat fii araa.diyi al-ma`rifaT

trans.eng: from the green garden of these blossoms which grow in the lands of knowledge,

orig.arab: `inda tajalliyi anwaari adh-dhaat fii maraayaa al-asmaa'u wa a.s-.sifaat

trans.eng: beside the orient lights of the Essence in the mirrors of names and attributes

orig.arab: layaakhudha ash-shuwq zamaami a.s-.sabr wa al-i.s.tibaar `an kaffika

trans.eng: yearning would seize the reins of patience and reserve from out thy hand,

orig.arab: wa yahtaza ruu.hika min bawaariqi al-anwaar

trans.eng: and make thy soul to shake with the flashing light,

orig.arab: wa tujdhibaka min al-wa.tani at-turaabii ilY al-wa.tani al-a.sliya al-il_ahii fii qu.tbi al-ma`aanii

trans.eng: and draw thee from the earthly homeland to the first, heavenly abode in the Center of Realities,

orig.arab: wa ta.s`aduka ilY maqaamiN ta.tiira fii al-hawaa' kamaatamshiya `alY at-turaab

trans.eng: and lift thee to a plane wherein thou wouldst soar in the air even as thou walkest upon the earth,

orig.arab: wa tarka.da `alY al-maa' kamaa tarka.da `alY al-ar.d

trans.eng: and move over the water as thou runnest on the land.

orig.arab: fahanii'aN lii wa laka wa liman samaa ilY samaa'i al-`irfaan wa .sabaa'i qalbihu bimaahabba `alY riiaa.di

trans.eng: Wherefore, may it rejoice Me, and thee, and whosoever mounteth into the heaven of knowledge, and whose heart is refreshed by this,

orig.arab: sarrihu .sabaa'i al-iiqaan min sabaa'i ar-ra.hman

trans.eng: that the wind of certitude hath blown over the garden of his being, from the Sheba of the All-Merciful.

orig.arab: wa as-salaamu `alY man ittaba`a al-hudY

trans.eng: Peace be upon him who followeth the Right Path!

orig.pers: va ba`d maraatib-i seyr-i saalikaan-raa az maskan-i khaakii bi-va.tan-i il_ahii haft rutbih mu`ayan namuudih-and

trans.eng: And further: The stages that mark the wayfarer's journey from the abode of dust to the heavenly homeland are said to be seven.

entry.def: Steps; grades; degrees, gradations of rank; times; affairs; particulars; storys (of a house).

orig.pers: chinaanchih ba`.d-ii haft vaadii va ba`.d-ii haft shahr dhikr kardih-and

trans.eng: Some have called these Seven Valleys, and others, Seven Cities.

orig.pers: va guftih-and kih saalik taa az nafs hijrat nanamaayad va iin asfaar-raa .tey nakunad

trans.eng: And they say that until the wayfarer taketh leave of self, and traverseth these stages,

orig.pers: bi-ba.hr-i qurb va vi.saal vaarid nashavad va az khamr-i bii-mithaal nachishad

trans.eng: he shall never reach to the ocean of nearness and union, nor drink of the peerless wine.

orig.pers: avval vaadii .talab ast markab-i iin vaadii .sabr ast

trans.eng: The first is the Valley of Search. The steed of this Valley is patience;

orig.pers: va musaafir dar iin safar bii .sabr bi-jaa-ii narisad va bi-maq.suud vaa.sil nashavad

trans.eng: without patience the wayfarer on this journey will reach nowhere and attain no goal.

orig.pers: va baayad hargiz afsurdih nagardad agar .sad hizaar saal sa`ii kunad va jamaal-i duust nabiinad pazhmurdih nashavad

trans.eng: Nor should he ever be downhearted; if he strive for a hundred thousand years and yet fail to behold the beauty of the Friend, he should not falter.

orig.pers: ziiraa mujaahidiin-i ka`bih-i fiinaa bi-bishaarat-i lanahdiyannahum subulanaa masruur-and

trans.eng: For those who seek the ^ka`bih of for Us rejoice in the tidings: In our ways will We guide them.

orig.pers: va kamar-i khidmat dar .talab bi-ghaayat mu.hkam bastih-and va dar har aan az makaan-i ghaflat bi-imkaan-i .talab safar kunand

trans.eng: In their search, they have stoutly girded up the loins of service, and seek at every moment to journey from the plane of heedlessness into the realm of being.

orig.pers: hiich band-ii iishaan-raa man` nanamaayad va hiich pand-ii sad nakunad

trans.eng: No bond shall hold them back, and no counsel shall deter them.

orig.pers: va shar.t ast iin `ibaad-raa kih dil-raa kih manba`-i khaziinih-i il_ahiyyih ast az har naqsh-ii paak kunand

trans.eng: It is incumbent on these servants that they cleanse the heart which is the wellspring of divine treasures from every marking,

orig.pers: va az taqliid kih az athar-i aabaa' va ajdaad ast i`raa.d namaayand

trans.eng: and that they turn away from imitation, which is following the traces of their forefathers and sires,

orig.pers: va abvaab-i duustii va dushmanii-raa baa kull-i ahl-i ar.d masduud kunand

trans.eng: and shut the door of friendliness and enmity upon all the people of the earth.

orig.pers: va .taalib dar iin safar bi-maqaam-ii risad kih hamih-i muwjuudaat-raa dar .talab-i duust sargashtih biinad

trans.eng: In this journey the seeker reacheth a stage wherein he seeth all created things wandering distracted in search of the Friend.

orig.pers: chih ya`quub-haa biinad kih dar .talab-i yuusuf aavaarih maandih-and

trans.eng: How many a Jacob will he see, hunting after his Joseph;

orig.pers: `aalam-ii .habiib biinad kih dar .talab-i ma.hbuub davaan-and

trans.eng: he will behold many a lover, hasting to seek the Beloved,

orig.pers: va jahaan-ii `aashiq mulaa.hi.zih kunad kih dar pey-i ma`shuuq ravaan

trans.eng: he will witness a world of desiring ones searching after the one Desired.

orig.pers: va dar har aan-ii amr-ii mushaahidih kunad va dar har saa`at-ii bar sirr-ii mu.tali` gardad

trans.eng: At every moment he findeth a weighty matter, in every hour he becometh aware of a mystery;

orig.pers: ziiraa kih dil az har do jahaan bardaashtih va `azm-i ka`bih-i jaanaan namuudih

trans.eng: for he hath taken his heart away from both worlds, and set out for the ^ka'bih of the Beloved.

orig.pers: va dar har qadam-ii i`aanat-i gheybii uu-raa shaamil shavad va juush-i .talab-ash ziiaadih gardad

trans.eng: At every step, aid from the Invisible Realm will attend him and the heat of his search will grow.

orig.pers: .talab-raa baayad az majnuun-i `ishq andaazih girift

trans.eng: One must judge of search by the standard of the ^majnuun of Love.

orig.pers: .hikaayat kunand kih ruuz-ii majnuun-raa diidand khaak miibiikht va ashg miiriikht

trans.eng: It is related that one day they came upon Majnun sifting the dust, and his tears flowing down.

orig.pers: guftand chih miikunii guft leylii-raa miijuuyam

trans.eng: They said, What doest thou? He said, I seek for ^leylii.

orig.pers: guftand vaay bar to leylii az ruu.h-i paak va to az khaak .talab miikunii

trans.eng: They cried, Alas for thee! ^leylii is of pure spirit, and thou seekest her in the dust!

orig.pers: guft hamih jaa dar .talab-ash miikuusham shaayad dar jaa-ii bijuuyam

trans.eng: He said, I seek her everywhere; haply somewhere I shall find her.

orig.pers: balii dar turaab rabbu al-arbaab justan agar chih nazd-i `aaqil qabii.h ast l_akin bar kamaal-i jidd va .talab daliil ast

trans.eng: Yea, although to the wise it be shameful to seek the Lord of Lords in the dust, yet this betokeneth intense ardor in searching.

eng.quote: Whoso seeketh out a thing with zeal shall find it.

orig.pers: .taalib-i .saadiq juz vi.saal-i ma.tluub chiiz-ii najuuyad va .habiib-raa juz vi.saal-i ma.hbuub maq.suud-ii nabaashad

trans.eng: The true seeker hunteth naught but the object of his quest, and the lover hath no desire save union with his beloved.

orig.pers: va iin .talab-i .taalib-raa .haa.sil nashavad magar binithaar aanchih hast

trans.eng: Nor shall the seeker reach his goal unless he sacrifice all things.

orig.pers: ya`nii aanchih diidih va shaniidih va fahmiidih hamih-raa bi-nafii-i laa manfii saazad taa bi-shahristaan-i jaan kih madiinih-i illaa ast vaa.sil shavad

trans.eng: That is, whatever he hath seen, and heard, and understood, all must he set at naught, that he may enter the realm of the spirit, which is the City of God.

orig.pers: himmat-ii baayad taa dar .talab-ash kuushiim va jahd-ii baayad taa az shahd-i va.sl-ash nuushiim

trans.eng: Labor is needed, if we are to seek Him; ardor is needed, if we are to drink of the honey of reunion with Him;

orig.pers: agar az iin jaam nuush kuniim `aalam-ii faraamuush kuniim

trans.eng: and if we taste of this cup, we shall cast away the world.

orig.pers: va saalik dar iin safar bar har khaak-ii jaalis shavad va dar har bilaad-ii saakin gardad

trans.eng: On this journey the traveler abideth in every land and dwelleth in every region.

orig.pers: az har vajh-ii .talab-i jamaal-i duust kunad va dar har diiaar .talab-i yaar namaayad

trans.eng: In every face, he seeketh the beauty of the Friend; in every country he looketh for the Beloved.

orig.pers: baa har jam`-ii mujtami` shavad va baa har sar-ii hamsarii namaayad

trans.eng: He joineth every company, and seeketh fellowship with every soul,

orig.pers: kih shaayad dar sar-ii sirr-i ma.hbuub biinad va yaa az .suurat-ii jamaal-i ma.hbuub mushaahidih kunad

trans.eng: that haply in some mind he may uncover the secret of the Friend, or in some face he may behold the beauty of the Loved one.

orig.pers: va agar dar iin safar bi-i`aanat-i baar-ii az yaar-i bii-nishaan nishaan yaaft

trans.eng: And if, by the help of God, he findeth on this journey a trace of the traceless Friend,

orig.pers: va buu-i yuusuf-i gumgashtih az bashiir-i a.hadiyyih shaniid

trans.eng: and inhaleth the fragrance of the long-lost Joseph from the heavenly messenger,

orig.pers: fuwraN bi-vaadii-i `ishq qadam gudhaarad va az naar-i `ishq bigudaazad

trans.eng: he shall straightway step into the Valley of Love and be dissolved in the fire of love.

orig.pers: dar iin shahr aasmaan-i jadhb buland shavad va aaftaab-i jahaantaab-i shuwq .taali` gardad va naar-i `ishq bar-afruuzad
va chuun naar-i `ishq bar-afruukht kharman-i `aql bi-kulii bisuukht

trans.eng: and when the fire of love is ablaze, it burneth to ashes the harvest of reason.

orig.pers: dar iin vaqt saalik az khuwd va gheyr-i khuwd bii-khabar ast

trans.eng: Now is the traveler unaware of himself, and of aught besides himself.

orig.pers: nah jahl va `ilm daanad va nah shakk va yaqiin nah .sub.h-i hidaayat shinaasad va nah shaam-i .dilaalat

trans.eng: He seeth neither ignorance nor knowledge, neither doubt nor certitude; he knoweth not the morn of guidance from the night of error.

orig.pers: az kufr va iimaan har do dar gariiz va samm-i qaatil-ash dil-padhiir

trans.eng: He fleeth both from unbelief and faith, and deadly poison is a balm to him.

orig.pers: iin-ast kih `a.t.taar guftih

trans.eng: Wherefore `^a.t.taar saith:

poem.line: kufr-i kaafir-raa va diin-i diindaar-raa
dharrih-i dard-at dil-i `a.t.taar-raa
For the infidel, errorfor the faithful, faith;
For `^a.t.taar's heart, an atom of Thy pain.

orig.pers: markab-i iin vaadii dard ast

trans.eng: The steed of this Valley is pain;

orig.pers: va agar dard nabaashad hargiz iin safar tamaam nashavad

trans.eng: and if there be no pain this journey will never end.

orig.pers: va `aashiq dar iin rutbih juz ma`shuuq khiiaal-ii nadaarad va juz ma.hbuub panaah-ii najuuyad

trans.eng: In this station the lover hath no thought save the Beloved, and seeketh no refuge save the Friend.

orig.pers: va dar har aan .sad jaan raayigaan dar rah-i jaanaan dahad va dar har qadam-ii hizaar sar dar paa-i duust andaazad

trans.eng: At every moment he offereth a hundred lives in the path of the Loved one, at every step he throweth a thousand heads at the feet of the Beloved.

orig.pers: ey baraadar-i man taa bi-mi.sr-i `ishq darnyaa-ii bi-yuusuf-i jamaal-i duust vaa.sil nashavii
va taa chuun ya`quub az chashm-i .zaahirii nagudharii chashm-i baa.tin nagushaa'ii

trans.eng: and until, like Jacob, thou forsake thine outward eyes, thou shalt never open the eye of thine inward being;

orig.pers: va taa bi-naar-i `ishq nayafruuzii bi-yaar-i shuwq nayaamiizii

trans.eng: and until thou burn with the fire of love, thou shalt never commune with the Lover of Longing.

orig.pers: va `aashiq-raa az hiich chiiz parvaa niist va az hiich .durr-ii .darar nah

trans.eng: A lover feareth nothing and no harm can come nigh him:

orig.pers: az naar sard-ash biinii va az daryaa khushk-ash yaabii

trans.eng: Thou seest him chill in the fire and dry in the sea.

poem.line: nishaan-i `aashiq aan baashad kih sard-ash biinii az duuzakh
nishaan-i `aarif aan baashad kih khushk-ash biinii az daryaa
A lover is he who is chill in hell fire;
A knower is he who is dry in the sea.

orig.pers: `ishq hastii qabuul nakunad va zindigii nakhwaahad

trans.eng: Love accepteth no existence and wisheth no life:

orig.pers: .hayaat dar mamaat biinad va `izzat az dhillat juuyad

trans.eng: He seeth life in death, and in shame seeketh glory.

orig.pers: bisyaar huush baayad taa laayiq-i juush-i `ishq shavad

trans.eng: To merit the madness of love, man must abound in sanity;

orig.pers: va bisyaar sar baayad taa qaabil-i kamand-i duust gardad

trans.eng: to merit the bonds of the Friend, he must be full of spirit.

orig.pers: mubaarak gardan-ii kih dar kamand-ash uftad va far-khandih sar-ii kih dar raah-i mu.habbat-ash bi-khaak uftad

trans.eng: Blessed the neck that is caught in His noose, happy the head that falleth on the dust in the pathway of His love.

orig.pers: pas ey duust az nafs bii-gaanih sho taa bi-yigaanih pey barii va az khaakdaan-i faanii bugdhar taa dar aashyaan-i il_ahii jaay giirii

trans.eng: Wherefore, O friend, give up thy self that thou mayest find the Peerless one, pass by this mortal earth that thou mayest seek a home in the nest of heaven.

orig.pers: niistii baayad taa naar-i hastii bar-afruuzii va maqbuul-i raah-i `ishq shavii

trans.eng: Be as naught, if thou wouldst kindle the fire of being and be fit for the pathway of love.

poem.line: nakunad `ishq nafs-i zindih qabuul
nakunad baaz muush-i murdih shikaar
Love seizeth not upon a living soul,
The falcon preyeth not on a dead mouse.

orig.pers: `ishq dar har aan-ii `aalam-ii bisuuzad va dar har diiaar kih `alam bar-afraazad viiraan saazad

trans.eng: Love setteth a world aflame at every turn, and he wasteth every land where he carrieth his banner.

orig.pers: dar mamlikat-ash hastii-raa vujuud-ii nah va dar sal.tanat-ash `aaqilaan-raa maqarr-ii nah

trans.eng: Being hath no existence in his kingdom; the wise wield no command within his realm.

orig.pers: nahang-i `ishq adiib-i `aql-raa bibal`ad va labiib-i daanish bishkurad

trans.eng: The leviathan of love swalloweth the master of reason and destroyeth the lord of knowledge.

orig.pers: haft daryaa biiaashaamad va `a.tash-i qalb-ash nayafsurad va hal min maziid guuyad

trans.eng: He drinketh the seven seas, but his heart's thirst is still unquenched, and he saith, Is there yet any more?

orig.pers: az khwiish bii-gaanih shavad va az har chih dar `aalam ast kinaarih giirad

trans.eng: He shunneth himself and draweth away from all on earth.

poem.line: baa do `aalam `ishq-raa bii-gaanigii
andar uu haftaad o do diivaanigii
Love's a stranger to earth and heaven too;
In him are lunacies seventy-and-two.

orig.pers: .sad hizaar ma.zluumaan dar kamand-ash bastih va .sad hizaar `aarifaan bi-tiir-ash khastih

trans.eng: He hath bound a myriad victims in his fetters, wounded a myriad wise men with his arrow.

orig.pers: har surkh-ii kih dar `aalam biinii az qahr-ash daan va har zard-ii kih dar rukhsaar biinii az zahr-ash shumur

trans.eng: Know that every redness in the world is from his anger, and every paleness in men's cheeks is from his poison.

orig.pers: juz fanaa davaa'ii nabakhshad va juz dar vaadii-i `adam qadam nagudhaarad

trans.eng: He yieldeth no remedy but death, he walketh not save in the valley of the shadow;

orig.pers: va l_akin zahr-ash dar kaam-i `aashiq az shahd khuwsh-tar va fanaa-ash dar na.zar-i .taalib az .sad hizaar baqaa ma.hbuub-tar ast

trans.eng: yet sweeter than honey is his venom on the lover's lips, and fairer his destruction in the seeker's eyes than a hundred thousand lives.

orig.pers: pas baayad bi-naar-i `ishq .hijaab-haa-i nafs-i shey.taanii suukhtih shavad

trans.eng: Wherefore must the veils of the satanic self be burned away at the fire of love,

orig.pers: taa ruu.h baraa-i idraak maraatib-i siyyid-i luwlaak la.tiif va paakiizih gardad

trans.eng: that the spirit may be purified and cleansed and thus may know the station of the Lord of the Worlds.

poem.line: naar-i `ishq-ii bar-furuuz v jumlih hastii-haa bisuuz
pas qadam bardaar v andar kuuy-i `ushshaaqaan gudhaar
Kindle the fire of love and burn away all things,
Then set thy foot into the land of the lovers.

orig.pers: va agar `aashiq bi-taa'iidaat khaaliq az minqaar-i shaahiin-i `ishq bi-salaamat bugdharad dar mamlikat-i ma`rifat vaarid shavad

trans.eng: And if, confirmed by the Creator, the lover escapes from the claws of the eagle of love, he will enter the Valley of Knowledge

orig.pers: va az shak bi-yaqiin aayad va az .zulmat-i .dilaalat-i havY bi-nuur-i hidaayat-i taqvY raaji` gardad

trans.eng: and come out of doubt into certitude, and turn from the darkness of illusion to the guiding light of the fear of God.

orig.pers: va chashm-i ba.siirat-ash baaz shavad va baa .habiib-i khuwd bi-raaz mashghuul gardad

trans.eng: His inner eyes will open and he will privily converse with his Beloved;

orig.pers: dar-i .haqiiqat va niyaaz bigushaayad va abvaab-i majaaz dar bandad dar iin rutbih qa.daa-raa ri.daa dahad

trans.eng: he will set ajar the gate of truth and piety, and shut the doors of vain imaginings. He in this station is content with the decree of God,

orig.pers: va jang-raa .sul.h biinad va dar fanaa ma`aanii-i baqaa dark namaayad

trans.eng: and seeth war as peace, and findeth in death the secrets of everlasting life.

orig.pers: va bi-chashm-i sar va sirr dar aafaaq iijaad va anfus-i `ibaad asraar-i mu`aad biinad

trans.eng: With inward and outward eyes he witnesseth the mysteries of resurrection in the realms of creation and the souls of men,

orig.pers: va .hikmat-i .samadaanii-raa bi-qalb-i ruu.haanii dar ma.zaahir naamutinaahii-i il_ahii seyr farmaayad

trans.eng: and with a pure heart apprehendeth the divine wisdom in the endless Manifestations of God.

orig.pers: dar ba.hr qa.trih biinad va dar qa.trih asraar-i ba.hr mulaa.hi.zih kunad

trans.eng: In the ocean he findeth a drop, in a drop he beholdeth the secrets of the sea.

poem.line: dil-i har dharrih-ii kih bishkaafii
aaftaab-ii-sh dar miiaan biinii
Split the atom's heart, and lo!
Within it thou wilt find a sun.

orig.pers: va saalik dar iin vaadii dar aafariinish-i .haqq bi-biinish-i mu.tlaq makhaalif va mughaayir nabiinad

trans.eng: The wayfarer in this Valley seeth in the fashionings of the True one nothing save clear providence,

orig.pers: va dar har aan maa tarY fii khalqi ar-ra.hm_an min tafaawuti faarija`i al-ba.sar hal tarY min fu.tuur guuyad

trans.eng: and at every moment saith: No defect canst thou see in the creation of the God of Mercy: Repeat the gaze: Seest thou a single flaw?

orig.pers: dar .zulm `adl biinad va dar `adl fa.dl mushaahidih kunad

trans.eng: He beholdeth justice in injustice, and in justice, grace.

orig.pers: dar jahl `ilm-haa mastuur biinad va dar `ilm-haa .sad hizaar .hikmat-haa aashikaar va huveydaa idraak namaayad

trans.eng: In ignorance he findeth many a knowledge hidden, and in knowledge a myriad wisdoms manifest.

orig.pers: va qafas-i tan va havY bishkanad va bi-nafas-i ahl-i baqaa uns giirad

trans.eng: He breaketh the cage of the body and the passions, and consorteth with the people of the immortal realm.

orig.pers: bi-nard-i baan-haa-i ma`navii .su`uud namaayad va bi-samaa' ma`aanii bi-shitaabad

trans.eng: He mounteth on the ladders of inner truth and hasteneth to the heaven of inner significance.

orig.pers: dar fulk-i sanaryahum aayaatanaa fii al-aafaaq wa fii anfusihum saakin shavad

trans.eng: He rideth in the ark of we shall show them our signs in the regions and in themselves,

orig.pers: va bar ba.hr-i .hattY yatabbayyina lahum inahu al-.haq saa'ir gardad

trans.eng: and journeyeth over the sea of until it become plain to them that (this Book) is the truth.

orig.pers: va agar .zulm-ii biinad .sabr namaayad va agar qahr biinad mihr aarad

trans.eng: And if he meeteth with injustice he shall have patience, and if he cometh upon wrath he shall manifest love.

orig.pers: .hikaayat kunand `aashiq-ii saal-haa dar hijr-i ma`shuuq-ash jaan miibaakht va dar aatish-i faraaq-ash miigudaakht

trans.eng: There was once a lover who had sighed for long years in separation from his beloved, and wasted in the fire of remoteness.

orig.pers: az ghalabih-i `ishq .sadr-ash az .sabr khaalii maand va jism-ash az ruu.h bii-zaarii just

trans.eng: From the rule of love, his heart was empty of patience, and his body weary of his spirit;

orig.pers: va zindigii dar faraaq-raa az nifaaq miishumurd va az aafaaq bi-ghaayat dar i.htiraaq buud

trans.eng: he reckoned life without her as a mockery, and time consumed him away.

orig.pers: chih ruuz-haa kih az hijr-ash raa.hat najustih va basaa shab-haa kih az dard-ash nakhuftih

trans.eng: How many a day he found no rest in longing for her; how many a night the pain of her kept him from sleep;

orig.pers: az .da`f badan chuun aahii gashtih va az dard-i dil chuun vaay shudih

trans.eng: his body was worn to a sigh, his heart's wound had turned him to a cry of sorrow.

orig.pers: bi-yik shurbih-i va.sl-ash hizaar jaan raayigaan miidaad va muyassar nimiishud

trans.eng: He had given a thousand lives for one taste of the cup of her presence, but it availed him not.

orig.pers: .tabiib-aan az `ilaaj-ash dar maandand va mu'aanisaan az uns-ash duurii justand

trans.eng: The doctors knew no cure for him, and companions avoided his company;

orig.pers: balii marii.d-i `ishq-raa .tabiib chaarih nadaanad magar `inaayat-i .habiib dast-ash giirad

trans.eng: yea, physicians have no medicine for one sick of love, unless the favor of the beloved one deliver him.

orig.pers: baar-ii `aaqibat shajar-i rijaa-ash thamar-i ya's bakhshiid va naar-i umiid-ash biyafsurd

trans.eng: At last, the tree of his longing yielded the fruit of despair, and the fire of his hope fell to ashes.

orig.pers: taa aankih shab-ii az jaan bii-zaar shud va az khaanih bi-baazaar raft

trans.eng: Then one night he could live no more, and he went out of his house and made for the marketplace.

orig.pers: naagaah uu-raa `asas-ii ta`aaqub namuud

trans.eng: on a sudden, a watchman followed after him.

orig.pers: uu az piish taazaan va `asas az pey davaan

trans.eng: He broke into a run, with the watchman following;

orig.pers: taa aankih `asas-haa jam` shudand va az har .taraf raah-i faraar bar aan bii-qaraar bastand

trans.eng: then other watchmen came together, and barred every passage to the weary one.

orig.pers: va aan faqiir az dil miinaaliid va bi-a.traaf miidaviid va baa khuwd miiguft

trans.eng: And the wretched one cried from his heart, and ran here and there, and moaned to himself:

orig.pers: iin `asas `izraa'iil-i man ast kih bi-iin ta`jiil dar .talab-i man ast va yaa shaddaad-i bilaad ast kih dar kiin-i `ibaad ast

eng.quote: Surely this watchman is `^izraa'iil, my angel of death, following so fast upon me; or he is a tyrant of men, seeking to harm me.

orig.pers: aan khastih-i tiir-i `ishq bi-paa davaan buud va bi-dil naalaan

trans.eng: His feet carried him on, the one bleeding with the arrow of love, and his heart lamented.

orig.pers: taa bi-diivaar-i baagh-ii rasiid va bi-hizaar za.hmat va mi.hnat baalaa-i diivaar raft diivaar-ii bi-ghaayat buland diid

trans.eng: Then he came to a garden wall, and with untold pain he scaled it, for it proved very high;

orig.pers: az jaan gudhasht va khuwd-raa dar baagh andaakht

trans.eng: and forgetting his life, he threw himself down to the garden.

orig.pers: diid ma`shuuq-ash dar dast chiraagh-ii daarad va tafa.hu.s-i angushtar-ii miinamaayad kih az uu gum shudih buud

trans.eng: And there he beheld his beloved with a lamp in her hand, searching for a ring she had lost.

orig.pers: chuun aan `aashiq-i dil-daadih ma`shuuq-i dil burdih-raa diid aahii bar-kashiid va dast bi-du`aa bar-daasht

trans.eng: When the heart-surrendered lover looked on his ravishing love, he drew a great breath and raised up his hands in prayer, crying:

orig.pers: kih ey khudaa iin `asas-raa `izzat diH va duwlat bakhsh va baaqii daar

trans.eng: o God! Give Thou glory to the watchman, and riches and long life.

orig.pers: kih iin `asas jibri'iil buud kih daliil-i iin `aliil gasht yaa israafiil buud kih .hayaat bakhsh-i iin dhaliil shud

trans.eng: For the watchman was Gabriel, guiding this poor one; or he was ^israafiil, bringing life to this wretched one!

orig.pers: va aanchih guft fii al-.haqiiqih durust buud ziiraa mulaa.hi.zih shud kih iin .zulm munkir-i `asas chiqadr `adl-haa dar sar daasht

trans.eng: Indeed, his words were true, for he had found many a secret justice in this seeming tyranny of the watchman,

orig.pers: va chih ra.hmat-haa dar pardih panhaan namuudih buud

trans.eng: and seen how many a mercy lay hid behind the veil.

orig.pers: bi-yik qahr tashnih-i .sa.hraa-i `ishq-raa bi-ba.hr-i ma`shuuq vaa.sil namuud va .zulmat-i faraaq-raa bi-nuur-i vi.saal ruwshan farmuud

trans.eng: Out of wrath, the guard had led him who was athirst in love's desert to the sea of his loved one, and lit up the dark night of absence with the light of reunion.

orig.pers: ba`iid-ii-raa bi-bustaan-i qurb jaay daad va `aliil-ii-raa bi-.tabiib-i qalb raah namuud

trans.eng: He had driven one who was afar, into the garden of nearness, had guided an ailing soul to the heart's physician.

orig.pers: .haal aan `aashiq agar aakhir biin buud dar avval bar `asas ra.hmat miinamuud va du`aa-ash miiguft va aan .zulm-raa `adl miidiid
chuun az aakhir ma.hjuub buud dar avval naalih aaghaaz namuud va bi-shikaayat zabaan gushuud

trans.eng: but since the end was veiled to him, he moaned and made his plaint in the beginning.

orig.pers: va l_akin musaafir-aan-i .hadiiqih-i `irfaan chuun aakhir-raa dar avval biinand

trans.eng: Yet those who journey in the garden land of knowledge, because they see the end in the beginning,

orig.pers: lah_adhaa dar jang .sul.h va dar qahr aashtii mulaa.hi.zih kunand

trans.eng: see peace in war and friendliness in anger.

orig.pers: va iin rutbih ahl-i iin vaadii ast

trans.eng: Such is the state of the wayfarers in this Valley;

orig.pers: va ahl-i vaadii-haa-i fuwq iin vaadii avval va aakhir-raa yik biinand balkih nah avval biinand nah aakhir laa avval va laa aakhir biinand

trans.eng: but the people of the Valleys above this see the end and the beginning as one; nay, they see neither beginning nor end, and witness neither first nor last.

orig.pers: balkih ahl-i madiinih-i baqaa kih dar ruw.dih-i kha.draa saakinand laa avval va laa aakhir ham nabiinand az avval-haa dar guriizand va bi-aakhir-haa darsitiiz

trans.eng: Nay rather, the denizens of the undying city, who dwell in the green garden land, see not even neither first nor last; they fly from all that is first, and repulse all that is last.

orig.pers: ziiraa kih `avaalim-i asmaa'-raa .tey namuudih-and va az `avaalim-i .sifaat chuun barq dar gudhashtih-and

trans.eng: For these have passed over the worlds of names, and fled beyond the worlds of attributes as swift as lightning.

orig.pers: chinaanchih miifarmaayad kamaali al-tuw.hiid nafyi a.s-.sifaat `anhu

trans.eng: Thus is it said: Absolute Unity excludeth all attributes.

orig.pers: va dar .zill-i dhaat maskan giriftih-and

trans.eng: And they have made their dwelling-place in the shadow of the Essence.

orig.pers: iin-ast kih khwaajih `abdul-ll_ah qadasa al-l_ah ta`aalY sirrihu al-`aziiz

trans.eng: Wherefore, relevant to this, ^khaajih ^`abdul-ll_ah may God the Most High sanctify his beloved spirit

orig.pers: dar iin maqaam nuktih-i daqiiq-ii va kalamih-i baliigh-ii dar ma`nii-i ihdinaa a.s-.siraa.ta al-mustaqiim farmuudih-and

trans.eng: hath made a subtle point and spoken an eloquent word as to the meaning of Guide Thou us on the straight path,

orig.pers: va aan iin-ast kih bi-namaay bi-maa raah-i raast

trans.eng: which is: Show us the right way,

orig.pers: ya`nii bi-mu.hibat-i dhaat-i khuwd musharraf daar taa az iltifaat bi-khuwd va gheyr-i to aazaad gashtih

trans.eng: that is, honor us with the love of Thine Essence, that we may be freed from turning toward ourselves and toward all else save Thee,

orig.pers: bi-tamaam-ii giriftaar-i to gardiim juz to nadaaniim juz to nabiiniim va juz to nayandiishiim

trans.eng: and may become wholly Thine, and know only Thee, and see only Thee, and think of none save Thee.

orig.pers: balkih az iin maqaam ham baalaa ravand

trans.eng: Nay, these even mount above this station,

orig.pers: chinaanchih miifarmaayad al-mu.habbaTi .hijaabiN bayna al-mu.hibbi wa al-ma.hbuub biish az iin guftan maraa dastuur niist

trans.eng: wherefore it is said: Love is a veil betwixt the lover and the loved one; More than this I am not permitted to tell.

orig.pers: dar iin vaqt .sub.h-i ma`rifat .taali` shud va chiraagh-haa-i seyr va suluuk khaamuush gasht

trans.eng: At this hour the morn of knowledge hath arisen and the lamps of wayfaring and wandering are quenched.

poem.line: vahm-i muusY baa hamih nuur o hunar
shud az aan ma.hjuub to bii par mapar
Veiled from this was Moses,
Though all strength and light;
Then thou who hast no wings at all,
Attempt not flight.

orig.pers: agar ahl-i raaz va niiaaz-ii bi-par-haa-i himmat-i uwliiaa parvaaz kun

trans.eng: If thou be a man of communion and prayer, soar up on the wings of assistance from Holy Souls,

orig.pers: taa asraar-i duust biinii va bi-anvaar-i ma.hbuub rasii inaalill_ahi wa innaa ilayhi raaji`uun

trans.eng: that thou mayest behold the mysteries of the Friend and attain to the lights of the Beloved, Verily, we are from God and to Him shall we return.

orig.pers: va saalik ba`d az seyr-i vaadii-i ma`rifat kih aakhir-i maqaam-i ta.hdiid ast bi-avval-i maqaam-i tuw.hiid vaa.sil shavad

trans.eng: After passing through the Valley of knowledge, which is the last plane of limitation, the wayfarer cometh to the Valley of Unity

orig.pers: va az ka's-i tajriid binuushad va dar ma.zaahir-i tafriid seyr namaayad

trans.eng: and drinketh from the cup of the Absolute, and gazeth on the Manifestations of Oneness.

orig.pers: dar iin maqaam .hijaab-i kithrat bar-dirad va az `avaalim-i shahvat bar-parad va dar samaa'i va.hdat `uruuj namaayad

trans.eng: In this station he pierceth the veils of plurality, fleeth from the worlds of the flesh, and ascendeth into the heaven of singleness.

orig.pers: bi-guush-i il_ahii bishnavad va bi-chashm-i rabbaanii asraar-i .san`-i .samdaanii biinad

trans.eng: With the ear of God he heareth, with the eye of God he beholdeth the mysteries of divine creation.

orig.pers: bi-khalvat-khaanih-i duust qadam gudhaarad va ma.hram-i suraadiq-i ma.hbuub shavad

trans.eng: He steppeth into the sanctuary of the Friend, and shareth as an intimate the pavilion of the Loved One.

orig.pers: va dast-i .haq az jeyb-i mu.tlaq bar-aarad va asraar-i qudrat .zaahir namaayad

trans.eng: He stretcheth out the hand of truth from the sleeve of the Absolute; he revealeth the secrets of power.

orig.pers: va.sf va ism va rasm az khuwd nabiinad va.sf-i khuwd-raa dar va.sf-i .haq biinad

trans.eng: He seeth in himself neither name nor fame nor rank, but findeth his own praise in praising God.

orig.pers: va ism-i .haq-raa dar ism-i khuwd mulaa.hi.zih namaayad

trans.eng: He beholdeth in his own name the name of God;

orig.pers: hamih aavaaz-haa az shah daanad va jamii`-i naghmaat-raa az uu shinavad

trans.eng: to him, all songs are from the King, and every melody from Him.

orig.pers: bar kursii-i qul kull min `inda al-ll_ah jaalis shavad va bar basaa.t-i laa .huula va laa quvaTi illaa bi-al-ll_ah raa.hat giirad

trans.eng: He sitteth on the throne of Say, all is from God, and taketh his rest on the carpet of There is no power or might but in God.

orig.pers: va dar ashyaa' bi-na.zar-i tuw.hiid mushaahidih kunad

trans.eng: He looketh on all things with the eye of oneness,

orig.pers: va ishraaq-i tajallii-i shams-i il_ahii-raa az mashriq-i huviiyat bar hamih-i mumkinaat yik-saan biinad

trans.eng: and seeth the brilliant rays of the divine sun shining from the dawning-point of Essence alike on all created things,

orig.pers: va anvaar-i tuw.hiid-raa bar jamii`-i muwjuudaat muwjuud va .zaahir mushaahidih kunad

trans.eng: and the lights of singleness reflected over all creation.

orig.pers: va ma`luum-i aan-janaab buudih kih jamii`-i ikhtilaafaat `avaalim kuwn kih dar maraatib-i suluuk saalik mushaahidih miikunad az na.zar-i khuwd-i saalik ast

trans.eng: It is clear to thine Eminence that all the variations which the wayfarer in the stages of his journey beholdeth in the realms of being, proceed from his own vision.

orig.pers: mathaalii dar iin maqaam dhikr miishavad taa iin ma`nY tamaam ma`luum gardad

trans.eng: We shall give an example of this, that its meaning may become fully clear:

orig.pers: mulaa.hi.zih dar shams-i .zaahir-ii farmaa'iid kih bar hamih-i muwjuudaat va mumkinaat bi-yik ishraaq tajallii miinamaayad

trans.eng: Consider the visible sun; although it shineth with one radiance upon all things,

orig.pers: va ifaa.dih-i nuur bi-amr-i sul.taan-i .zuhuur bar hamih-i ashyaa' miifarmaayad

trans.eng: and at the behest of the King of Manifestation bestoweth light on all creation,

orig.pers: va liikun dar har mu.hall bi-iqti.daa-i ista`daad aan mu.hall .zaahir miishavad va a`.taa-i fey.d miikunad

trans.eng: yet in each place it becometh manifest and sheddeth its bounty according to the potentialities of that place.

orig.pers: mithl-i iin-kih dar mir aat bi-qar.s-haa va heya't-haa jilvih miinamaayad va iin bi-vaas.tih-i li.taafat-i khuwd-i miraat ast

trans.eng: For instance, in a mirror it reflecteth its own disk and shape, and this is due to the sensitivity of the mirror;

orig.pers: va dar baluur naar i.hdaath miikunad va dar saayir-i ashyaa hamaan athar-i tajallii .zaahir ast nah qur.s

trans.eng: in a crystal it maketh fire to appear, and in other things it showeth only the effect of its shining, but not its full disk.

orig.pers: va bi-aan athar har shay'ii-raa bi-amr-i mu'aththir bi-isti`daad-i uu tarbiiyat miikunad chinaanchih mushaahidih miikuniid

trans.eng: And yet, through that effect, by the command of the Creator, it traineth each thing according to the quality of that thing, as thou observest.

orig.pers: va hamchiniin alvaan ham bi-iqti.daa-i mu.hall .zaahir miishavad

trans.eng: In like manner, colors become visible in every object according to the nature of that object.

orig.pers: mithl-i iin-kih dar zujaajih-i zard tajallii-i zard va dar sifiid tajallii-i sifiid va dar surkh tajallii-i surkh mulaa.hi.zih miishavad

trans.eng: For instance, in a yellow globe, the rays shine yellow; in a white the rays are white; and in a red, the red rays are manifest.

orig.pers: pas iin ikhtilaafaat az mu.hall ast nah az ishraaq-i .diiyaa'

trans.eng: Then these variations are from the object, not from the shining light.

orig.pers: va agar mu.hall maani` daashtih baashad mithl-i jidaar va saqf aan mu.hall bi-al-marrih az tajallii-i shams ma.hruum maanad va aaftaab bar aan nataabad

trans.eng: And if a place be shut away from the light, as by walls or a roof, it will be entirely bereft of the splendor of the light, nor will the sun shine thereon.

orig.pers: iin-ast kih ba`.d-ii az nufuus-i .da`iifih chuun araa.dii-i ma`rifat-raa bi-jadaar-i nafs va havY

trans.eng: Thus it is that certain invalid souls have confined the lands of knowledge within the wall of self and passion,

orig.pers: va .hijaab-i ghaflat va `amY .haayil namuudih-and

trans.eng: and clouded them with ignorance and blindness,

orig.pers: lihidhaa az ishraaq-i shams ma`aanii va asraar-i ma.hbuub laayazaalii ma.hjuub maandih-and

trans.eng: and have been veiled from the light of the mystic sun and the mysteries of the Eternal Beloved;

orig.pers: va az javaahir-i .hikmat-i diin-i mubiin-i siyyida al-mur saliin duur maandih-and

trans.eng: they have strayed afar from the jewelled wisdom of the lucid Faith of the Lord of Messengers,

orig.pers: va az .haram-i jamaal ma.hruum shudand

trans.eng: have been shut out of the sanctuary of the All-Beauteous One,

orig.pers: va az ka`bih-i jalaal mahjuur

trans.eng: and banished from the ^ka'bih of splendor.

orig.pers: iin-ast rutbih-i ahl-i zamaan

trans.eng: Such is the worth of the people of this age!

orig.pers: va agar bulbul-ii az gil-i nafs bar-khiizad va bar shaakhsaar-i gul-i qalb jaay giirad

trans.eng: And if a nightingale soar upward from the clay of self and dwell in the rose bower of the heart,

orig.pers: va bi-nighamaat-i .hijaazii va aavaaz-haa-i khuwsh-i `araaqii asraar-i il_ahii dhikr namaayad

trans.eng: and in Arabian melodies and sweet ^iiraanian songs recount the mysteries of God

orig.pers: kih .harf-ii az aan jamii`-i jasad-haa-i murdih-raa .hayaat-i taazih-i jadiid bakhshad

trans.eng: a single word of which quickeneth to fresh, new life the bodies of the dead,

orig.pers: va ruu.h-i quds-ii bar `a.zaam-i ramiimih-i mumkinaat mabdhuul daarad

trans.eng: and bestoweth the Holy Spirit upon the moldering bones of this existence

orig.pers: hizaar changaal-i .hasad va minqaar-i bugh.d biinii kih qa.sd-i uu namaayand va baa tamaam-i jidd dar halaak-ash kuushand

trans.eng: thou wilt behold a thousand claws of envy, a myriad beaks of rancor hunting after Him and with all their power intent upon His death.

orig.pers: balii ju`al-raa buu-i khuwsh naa-khuwsh aayad va mazkuum-raa raayi.hih-i .tayib thamar nadahad

trans.eng: Yea, to the beetle a sweet fragrance seemeth foul, and to the man sick of a rheum a pleasant perfume is as naught.

orig.pers: iin-ast kih baraa-i irshaad-i `avaam guftih-and

trans.eng: Wherefore, it hath been said for the guidance of the ignorant:

poem.line: daf` kun az maghz o az biinii zukaam
taa kih rii.hu al-ll_ah dar aayad dar mashaam
Cleanse thou the rheum from out thine head
And breathe the breath of God instead.

orig.pers: baar-ii ikhtilaaf-i mu.hall vaa.di.h va mubarhan shud

trans.eng: In sum, the differences in objects have now been made plain.

orig.pers: va ammaa na.zar-i saalik vaqt-ii dar mu.hall ma.hduud ast ya`nii dar zujaajaat-i seyr miinamaayad

trans.eng: Thus when the wayfarer gazeth only upon the place of appearance that is, when he seeth only the many-colored globes

orig.pers: iin-ast kih zard va surkh va sifiid biinad

trans.eng: he beholdeth yellow and red and white;

orig.pers: bi-iin jahat ast kih jidaal beyn-i `ibaad bar paa shudih

trans.eng: hence it is that conflict hath prevailed among the creatures,

orig.pers: va `aalam-raa ghubaar tiirih az anfus-i ma.hduudih faraag-raftih

trans.eng: and a darksome dust from limited souls hath hid the world.

orig.pers: va ba`.d-ii na.zar bi-ishraaq-i .duw' daarand va barkh-ii az khamar-i va.hdat nuushiidih-and juz shams chiiz-ii nabiinand

trans.eng: And some do gaze upon the effulgence of the light; and some have drunk of the wine of oneness and these see nothing but the sun itself.

orig.pers: pas bi-sabab-i seyr-i iin sih maqaam-i mukhtalif fahm-i saalikiin va bayaan-i iishaan mukhtalif miishavad
iin-ast kih athar-i ikhtilaaf dar `aalam .zaahir shudih va miishavad

trans.eng: and hence the sign of conflict doth continually appear on earth.

orig.pers: ziiraa kih ba`.d-ii dar rutbih-i tuw.hiid vaaqifand va az aan `aalam sukhan guuyand

trans.eng: For some there are who dwell upon the plane of oneness and speak of that world,

orig.pers: va barkh-ii dar `avaalim-i ta.hdiid qaa'im-and va ba`.d-ii dar maraatib-i nafs va barkh-ii bi-al-amrih mu.htajib-and

trans.eng: and some inhabit the realms of limitation, and some the grades of self, while others are completely veiled.

orig.pers: iin-ast kih juhhaal-i `a.sr kih az partuv-i jamaal na.siib naburdih-and bi-ba`.d-ii maqaal takallum miinamaayand

trans.eng: Thus do the ignorant people of the day, who have no portion of the radiance of Divine Beauty, make certain claims,

orig.pers: va dar har `a.sr va zamaan bar ahl-i lajjih-i tuw.hiid vaarid mii-aavarand aanchih-raa kih khuwd bi-aan laayiq va sizaa vaarand

trans.eng: and in every age and cycle inflict on the people of the sea of oneness what they themselves deserve.

arab.quote: wa-law yu'aa khidhu al-ll_ahu an-naasa bi-maakasabUA maataraka `alY .zahrihaa min da-'aabbaTiN wa-l_akin yu'akhkhiruhum 'ilY 'ajaliN musammYaN

trans.eng: Should God punish men for their perverse doings, He would not leave on earth a moving thing! But to an appointed term doth He respite them\ldots[^qur'aan 35:45]

orig.pers: ey baraadar-i man qalb-i la.tiif bi-manzalih-i aa'iinih ast

trans.eng: O My Brother! A pure heart is as a mirror;

orig.pers: aan-raa bi-.siiqal-i .hubb va inqi.taa` az maasavii al-ll_ah paak kun

trans.eng: cleanse it with the burnish of love and severance from all save God,

orig.pers: taa aftaab-i .haqiiqii dar aan jilvih namaayad va .sub.h-i azalii .taali` shavad

trans.eng: that the true sun may shine within it and the eternal morning dawn.

orig.pers: ma`nii-i laa yas`anii ar.dii va laa samaa'ii va l_akin yas`anii qalbi `abdii al-mu'min raa aashikaar va huveydaa biinii

trans.eng: Then wilt thou clearly see the meaning of Neither doth My earth nor My heaven contain Me, but the heart of My faithful servant containeth Me.

orig.pers: va jaan dar dast giirii va bi-hizaar .hasrat nithaar-i yaar-i taazih namaa'ii

trans.eng: And thou wilt take up thy life in thine hand, and with infinite longing cast it before the new Beloved One.

orig.pers: va chuun anvaar-i tajallii-i sul.taan-i a.hadiyyih bar `arsh-i qalb va dil juluus namuud

trans.eng: Whensoever the light of Manifestation of the King of Oneness settleth upon the throne of the heart and soul,

orig.pers: nuur-i uu dar jamii`-i a`.daa va arkaan .zaahir miishavad

trans.eng: His shining becometh visible in every limb and member.

orig.pers: aan vaqt sirr-i .hadiith-i mashhuur sar az .hajaab-i deyjuur bar-aarad

trans.eng: At that time the mystery of the famed tradition gleameth out of the darkness:

orig.pers: laa zaal al-`abd yataqarraba ilayya bi-an-navaafil .hattY a.hbabtahu fa-idhaa a.hbabtahu kun-tu sam`ihi aladhii yasma`a bihi alkh

eng.quote: A servant is drawn unto Me in prayer until I answer him; and when I have answered him, I become the ear wherewith he heareth...

orig.pers: ziiraa kih .saa.hib-i bayt dar bayt-i khuwd tajallii namuudih

trans.eng: For thus the Master of the house hath appeared within His home,

orig.pers: va arkaan-i bayt hamih az nuur-i uu ruwshan va munavvar shudih

trans.eng: and all the pillars of the dwelling are ashine with His light.

orig.pers: va fi`l va athar-i nuur az muniir ast

trans.eng: And the action and effect of the light are from the Light-Giver;

orig.pers: iin-ast kih hamih bih uu .harkat namaayand va bi-iraadih-i uu qiiaam kunand

trans.eng: so it is that all move through Him and arise by His will.

orig.pers: va iin-ast aan chashmih-ii kih muqarabiin az aan miinuushand

trans.eng: And this is that spring whereof the near ones drink,

orig.pers: chinaanchih miifarmaayad `aynaN yashriba bihaa al-muqarribuun

trans.eng: as it is said: A fount whereof the near unto God shall drink...

orig.pers: va diigar aankih mabaadaa dar iin bayaanaat raayi.hih-i .huluul

trans.eng: However, let none construe these utterances to be anthropomorphism,

orig.pers: va yaa tanazzulaat-i `avaalim-i .haq dar maraatib-i khalq ravd va bar aan-jinaab shubhih shavad

trans.eng: nor see in them the descent of the worlds of God into the grades of the creatures; nor should they lead thine Eminence to such assumptions.

orig.pers: ziiraa kih bi-dhaatih muqaddas ast az .su`uud va nazuul va az dakhuul va khuruuj

trans.eng: For God is, in His Essence, holy above ascent and descent, entrance and exit;

orig.pers: lam yazal az .sifaat-i khalq ghanii buudih va khwaahad bud

trans.eng: He hath through all eternity been free of the attributes of human creatures, and ever will remain so.

orig.pers: va nashnaakhtih uu-raa a.had-ii va bi-kunh-i uu raah nayaaftih nafs-ii

trans.eng: No man hath ever known Him; no soul hath ever found the pathway to His Being.

orig.pers: kull-i `urafaa dar vaadii-i ma`rifat-ash sar gardaan va kull-i uuliyaa dar idraak-i dhaat-ash .heyraan manazzih ast

trans.eng: Every mystic knower hath wandered far astray in the valley of the knowledge of Him; every saint hath lost his way in seeking to comprehend His Essence.

orig.pers: az idraak-i har mudrik-ii va muta`aalii ast az `irfaan har `aarif-ii

trans.eng: Sanctified is He above the understanding of the wise; exalted is He above the knowledge of the knowing!

orig.pers: as-sabiilu masduud va a.t-.talabu marduud

trans.eng: The way is barred and to seek it is impiety;

orig.pers: daliilih aayaatih va vujuudih ithbaatih

trans.eng: His proof is His signs; His being is His evidence.

orig.pers: iin-ast kih `aashiq-aan ruu-i jaanaan guftih-and yaaman dalla `alY dhaatihi bi-dhaatihi wa tanazzaha `an mujaanisaTi mukhluuqaatihi

trans.eng: Wherefore, the lovers of the face of the Beloved have said: O Thou, the One Whose Essence alone showeth the way to His Essence, and Who is sanctified above any likeness to His creatures.

orig.pers: `adam-i .sirf kujaa tavaanad dar maydaan-i qidam asb davaanad va saayih-i faanii kujaa bi-khuwrshiid-i baaqii risad

trans.eng: How can utter nothingness gallop its steed in the field of preexistence, or a fleeting shadow reach to the everlasting sun?

orig.pers: .habiib-i luwlaak, maa `arafnaaka farmuudih

trans.eng: The Friend hath said, But for Thee, we had not known Thee,

orig.pers: va ma.hbuub-i uwaadnY, maabilaghnaaka guftih

trans.eng: and the Beloved hath said, nor attained Thy presence.

orig.pers: balii iin dhikr-haa kih dar maraatib-i `irfaan dhikr miishavad

trans.eng: Yea, these mentionings that have been made of the grades of knowledge

orig.pers: ma`rifat-i tajalliiaat-i aan shams-i .haqiiqat ast kih dar maraayaa tajallii miifarmaayad

trans.eng: relate to the knowledge of the Manifestations of that Sun of Reality, which casteth Its light upon the Mirrors.

orig.pers: va tajallii-i aan nuur dar quluub hast va l_akin bi-.hujibaat-i nafsaaniyyih va shu'uunaat-i `ara.diyyih ma.hjuub ast

trans.eng: And the splendor of that light is in the hearts, yet it is hidden under the veilings of sense and the conditions of this earth,

orig.pers: chuun sham` ziir-i faanuus-i .hadiid chuun faanuus murtafi` shud nuur-i sham` .zaahir gardad

trans.eng: even as a candle within a lantern of iron, and only when the lantern is removed doth the light of the candle shine out.

orig.pers: va hamchiniin chuun kharq-i .hujibaat-i afkiyyih az vajh-i qalb namaa'ii anvaar-i a.hadiyyih .taali` shavad

trans.eng: In like manner, when thou strippest the wrappings of illusion from off thine heart, the lights of oneness will be made manifest.

orig.pers: pas ma`luum shud kih az baraa-i tajalliiaat ham dukhuul va khuruuj niist

trans.eng: Then it is clear that even for the rays there is neither entrance nor exit

orig.pers: taa chih risad bi-aan juwhar-i vujuud va sirr-i maq.suud

trans.eng: how much less for that Essence of Being and that longed-for Mystery.

orig.pers: ey baraadar man dar iin maraatib az ruu-i ta.hqiiq seyr namaa nah az ruu-i taqliid

trans.eng: O My Brother, journey upon these planes in the spirit of search, not in blind imitation.

orig.pers: va saalik-raa duur baash-i kalimaat man` nakunad va heymanih-i ishaarat sad nanamaayad

trans.eng: A true wayfarer will not be kept back by the bludgeon of words nor debarred by the warning of allusions.

poem.line: pardih chih baashad miiaan-i `aashiq o ma`shuuq
sadd-i sikandar nah maani` ast o nah .haa'il
How shall a curtain part the lover and the loved one?
Not Alexander's wall can separate them!

orig.pers: asraar bisyaar va aghyaar bii-shumaar

trans.eng: Secrets are many, but strangers are myriad.

orig.pers: sirr-i ma.hbuub-raa daftar-haa kifaayat nakunad va bi-iin alvaa.h itmaam nayaabad baa iin-kih .harf-ii biish niist va ramzii biish nah

trans.eng: Volumes will not suffice to hold the mystery of the Beloved One, nor can it be exhausted in these pages, although it be no more than a word, no more than a sign.

eng.quote: Knowledge is a single point, but the ignorant have multiplied it.

orig.pers: va az ham-iin maqaam ikhtilaafaat-i `avaalim-raa ham mulaa.hi.zih kun

trans.eng: On this same basis, ponder likewise the differences among the worlds.

orig.pers: agar chih `avaalim-i il_ahii naamutinaahii ast va l_akin ba`.d-ii chihaar rutbih dhikr namuudih-and

trans.eng: Although the divine worlds be never ending, yet some refer to them as four:

orig.pers: `aalam-i zamaan va aan aan-ast kih az baraa-i uu avval va aakhir baashad

trans.eng: The world of time (zamaan), which is the one that hath both a beginning and an end;

orig.pers: va `aalam-i dahr ya`nii avval daastih baashad va aakhir-ash padiid nabaashad

trans.eng: the world of duration (dahr), which hath a beginning, but whose end is not revealed;

orig.pers: va `aalam-i sarmad kih avval-ii mulaa.hi.zih nashavad va aakhir-ash mafhuum shavad
va `aalam-i azal kih nah avval-ii mushaahidih shavad va nah aakhir-ii

trans.eng: and the world of eternity (azal), neither a beginning nor an end of which is visible.

orig.pers: agar chih dar iin bayaanaat ikhtilaaf bisyaar ast agar taq.siil dhikr shavd kisaalat afzaayad

trans.eng: Although there are many differing statements as to these points, to recount them in detail would result in weariness.

orig.pers: chinaanchih ba`.d-ii `aalam-i sarmad-raa bii ibtidaa va intahaa guftih-and

trans.eng: Thus, some have said that the world of perpetuity hath neither beginning nor end,

orig.pers: va `aalam-i azal-raa gheyb-i manii`-i laa-yudrak dhikr namuudih-and

trans.eng: and have named the world of eternity as the invisible, impregnable Empyrean.

orig.pers: va ba`.d-ii `avaalim-i laahuut va jabaruut va malakuut va naasuut guftih-and

trans.eng: Others have called these the worlds of the Heavenly Court (^laahuut), of the Empyrean Heaven (^jabaruut), of the Kingdom of the Angels (^malakuut), and of the mortal world (^naasuut).

orig.pers: safar-haa-i sabiil-i `ishq-raa chihaar shumurdih-and

trans.eng: The journeys in the pathway of love are reckoned as four:

orig.arab: min al-khalqi ilii al-.haqq va min al-.haqqi ilii al-khalq va min al-khalqi ilii al-khalq va min al-.haqqi ilii al-.haq

trans.eng: From the creatures to the True One; from the True One to the creatures; from the creatures to the creatures; from the True One to the True One.

orig.pers: va hamchiniin bisyaar bayaanaat az `urafaa va .hukamaa-i qabl hast kih bandih muta`ri.d nashudam

trans.eng: There is many an utterance of the mystic seers and doctors of former times which I have not mentioned here,

orig.pers: va duust nadaaram kih adhkaar qabl bisyaar i.zhaar shavad

trans.eng: since I mislike the copious citation from sayings of the past;

orig.pers: ziiraa kih aqvaal gheyr-raa dhikr namuudan daliil ast bar `uluum-i kasbii nah bar muwhibat il_ahii

trans.eng: for quotation from the words of others proveth acquired learning, not the divine bestowal.

orig.pers: va l_akin iin-qadr ham kih dhikr shud bi-vaas.tih-i `aadat-i naas ast

trans.eng: Even so much as We have quoted here is out of deference to the wont of men and after the manner of the friends.

orig.pers: va ta-assii bi-a.s.haab va `alaavih bar iin dariin risaalih iin bayaanaat nagunjad

trans.eng: Further, such matters are beyond the scope of this epistle.

orig.pers: va `adam-i iqbaal bi-dhikr-i aqvaal-i iishaan nah az ghuruur ast bal bi-vaas.tih-i .zuhuur-i .hikmat va tajallii-i muwhibat ast

trans.eng: Our unwillingness to recount their sayings is not from pride, rather is it a manifestation of wisdom and a demonstration of grace.

poem.line: gar khi.dr dar ba.hr kashtii-raa shikast
.sad durustii dar shikast-i khi.dr hast
If ^khi.dr did wreck the vessel on the sea,
Yet in this wrong there are a thousand rights.

orig.pers: va illaa iin bandih khuwd-raa dar saa.hat-i yik-ii az a.hibaa-i khudaa ma`duum miidaanam va mafquud miishumuram taa chih risad dar basaa.t-i uulyaa

trans.eng: Otherwise, this Servant regardeth Himself as utterly lost and as nothing, even beside one of the beloved of God, how much less in the presence of His holy ones.

orig.arab: fasub.haana rabbii al-a`lY

trans.eng: Exalted be My Lord, the Supreme!

orig.pers: va az iin-haa gudhashtih maq.suud dhikr-i maraatib-i saalikiin ast nah bayaan-i aqvaal-i `aarifiin

trans.eng: Moreover, our aim is to recount the stages of the wayfarer's journey, not to set forth the conflicting utterances of the mystics.

orig.pers: agar chih mithaal-i mukhta.sar-ii dar avval va aakhir-i `aalam nisbii va i.daafii zadih shud

trans.eng: Although a brief example hath been given concerning the beginning and ending of the relative world, the world of attributes,

orig.pers: mujaddad mithaal-ii diigar dhikr miishavad taa tamaam-i ma`aanii dar qamii.s-i mithaal-ii .zaahir shavad

trans.eng: yet a second illustration is now added, that the full meaning may be manifest.

orig.pers: mathalaN aan-jinaab dar khuwd mulaa.hi.zih farmaayand

trans.eng: For instance, let thine Eminence consider his own self;

orig.pers: kih nisbat bi-pasar-i khuwd avvaland va nisbat bi-pidar-i khuwd aakhir

trans.eng: thou art first in relation to thy son, last in relation to thy father.

orig.pers: va dar .zaahir .hikaayat az .zaahir-i qudrat miikuniid dar `avaalim-i .sun`-i il_ahii

trans.eng: In thine outward appearance, thou tellest of the appearance of power in the realms of divine creation;

orig.pers: va dar baa.tin bar asraar-i baa.tin kih vadii`ih-i il_ahiyyih ast

trans.eng: in thine inward being thou revealest the hidden mysteries which are the divine trust deposited within thee.

orig.pers: dar shumaa pas .sidq-i avvaliyyat va aakhiriyyat va .zaahiriyyat va baa.tiniyyat bi-iin ma`nY kih dhikr shud bar shumaa miikunad

trans.eng: And thus firstness and lastness, outwardness and inwardness are, in the sense referred to, true of thyself,

orig.pers: taa dar iin chihaar rutbih kih bi-shumaa `inaayat shud chihaar rutbih-i il_ahiyyih-raa idraak farmaa'iid

trans.eng: that in these four states conferred upon thee thou shouldst comprehend the four divine states,

orig.pers: taa bulbul-i qalb bar jamii`-i shaakhsaar-haa-i gul-i vujuud az gheyb va shuhuud nidaa kunad

trans.eng: and that the nightingale of thine heart on all the branches of the rosetree of existence, whether visible or concealed, should cry out:

orig.pers: bi-anah huw al-awwal wa al-aakhir wa a.z-.zaahir wa al-baa.tin

eng.quote: He is the first and the last, the Seen and the Hidden...

orig.pers: va iin dhikr-haa dar maraatib-i `avaalim-i nisbat dhikr miishavad

trans.eng: These statements are made in the sphere of that which is relative, because of the limitations of men.

orig.pers: va illaa aan rijaal-ii kih bi-qadam-ii `aalam-i nisbat va taqyiid-raa .tey namuudih-and

trans.eng: Otherwise, those personages who in a single step have passed over the world of the relative and the limited,

orig.pers: va bar basaa.t-i khuwsh-i tajriid saakin shudih-and

trans.eng: and dwelt on the fair plane of the Absolute,

orig.pers: va dar `aalam-haa-i i.tlaaq va amr kheymih bar-afraakhtih-and

trans.eng: and pitched their tent in the worlds of authority and command

orig.pers: jamii`-i iin nisbat-haa-raa bi-naar-ii suukhtih-and

trans.eng: have burned away these relativities with a single spark,

orig.pers: va hamih-i iin alfaa.z-raa bi-nam-ii ma.hv namuudih-and

trans.eng: and blotted out these words with a drop of dew.

orig.pers: va dar yam-i ruu.h shinaavarii miinamaayand va dar havaa-i quds-i nuur seyr miikunand

trans.eng: And they swim in the sea of the spirit, and soar in the holy air of light.

orig.pers: diigar alfaa.z dar iin rutbih kujaa vujuud daarad taa avval yaa aakhir yaa gheyr-i iin-haa ma`luum shavd va madhkuur aayad

trans.eng: Then what life have words, on such a plane, that first and last or other than these be seen or mentioned!

orig.pers: dar iin maqaam avval nafs-i aakhir va aakhir nafs-i avval ast

trans.eng: In this realm, the first is the last itself, and the last is but the first.

poem.line: aatish-ii az `ishq-i jaanaan bar-furuuz
sar bi-sar fikr o `ibaadat-raa bisuuz
In thy soul of love build thou a fire
And burn all thoughts and words entire.

orig.pers: ey duust-i man dar khuwd mulaa.hi.zih farmaa

trans.eng: O my friend, look upon thyself:

orig.pers: kih agar pidar nimiishud-ii va pisar nadiidih buudii iin alfaa.z ham nashaniidih buudii

trans.eng: Hadst thou not become a father nor begotten a son, neither wouldst thou have heard these sayings.

orig.pers: pas .haal hamih-raa faraamuush kun taa dar mu.s.tabih-i tuw.hiid nazd-i adiib-i `ishq biyaamuuzii

trans.eng: Now forget them all, that thou mayest learn from the Master of Love in the schoolhouse of oneness,

orig.pers: va az innaa bih raaji`uun rij`at kunii

trans.eng: and return unto God,

orig.pers: va az baa.tin-i majaazii bi-maqaam-i .haqiqii-i khuwd vaa.sil gardii

trans.eng: and forsake the inner land of unreality for thy true station,

orig.pers: va dar .zil-i shajarih-i daanish saakin shavii

trans.eng: and dwell within the shadow of the tree of knowledge.

orig.pers: ey `aziiz nafs-raa faqiir nimaa taa dar `ar.sih-i buland-i ghanaa vaarad shavii

trans.eng: O thou dear one! Impoverish thyself, that thou mayest enter the high court of riches;

orig.pers: va jisad-raa dhaliil kun taa az sharii`ih-i `izzat biyaashaamii

trans.eng: and humble thy body, that thou mayest drink from the river of glory,

orig.pers: va bi-jamii`-i ma`aanii-i ash`aar kih su'aal farmuudii birasii

trans.eng: and attain to the full meaning of the poems whereof thou hadst asked.

orig.pers: pas ma`luum shud kih iin maraatib bastih bi-seyr-i saalik ast

trans.eng: Thus it hath been made clear that these stages depend on the vision of the wayfarer.

orig.pers: va dar har madiinih `aalam-ii biinad va dar har vaadii bi-chashmih-ii risad va dar har .sa.hraa naghmih-ii shinavad

trans.eng: In every city he will behold a world, in every Valley reach a spring, in every meadow hear a song.

orig.pers: valii shaah-baaz-i havaa-i ma`navii-raa shahnaaz-haa-i badii`-i ruu.haanii dar dil ast

trans.eng: But the falcon of the mystic heaven hath many a wondrous carol of the spirit in His breast,

orig.pers: va murgh-i `araaqii-raa aavaaz-haa-i khuwsh-i .hijaaz-ii dar sar

trans.eng: and the Persian bird keepeth in His soul many a sweet Arab melody;

orig.pers: va l_akin mastuur buudih va mastuur khwaahad buud

trans.eng: yet these are hidden, and hidden shall remain.

poem.line: gar biguuyam `aql-haa bar ham zanad
var niviisam bas qalam-haa bishkanad
If I speak forth, many a mind will shatter,
And if I write, many a pen will break.

orig.arab: wa as-salaamu `alY man qa.ta`a h_adha as-safari al-a`lY wa ittaba`a al-.haqqi bi-anvaari al-hudY

trans.eng: Peace be upon him who concludeth this exalted journey and followeth the True One by the lights of guidance.

orig.pers: va saalik ba`d az qa.t`-i ma`aarij-i iin safar-i buland-i a`lY dar madiinih-i istighnaa vaarid miishavad

trans.eng: And the wayfarer, after traversing the high planes of this supernal journey, entereth the Valley of Contentment.

orig.pers: va dar iin vaadii nasaa'im-i istighnaa-i il_ahii-raa bibiinad kih az baydaa-i ruu.h miivazad

trans.eng: In this Valley he feeleth the winds of divine contentment blowing from the plane of the spirit.

orig.pers: va .hijaab-haa-i faqr-raa miisuuzad

trans.eng: He burneth away the veils of want,

orig.pers: va yuumi yaghnii al-ll_ah kulaN min sa`atihi raa bi-chashm-i .zaahir va baa.tin dar gheyb va shihaadaT ashyaa' mushaahidih farmaayad

trans.eng: and with inward and outward eye, perceiveth within and without all things the day of: God will compensate each one out of His abundance.

orig.pers: az .huzn bi-suruur aayad va az gham bi-fara.h raaji` shavad

trans.eng: From sorrow he turneth to bliss, from anguish to joy.

orig.pers: qab.d va inqibaa.d-raa bi-bas.t va inbisaa.t tabdiil namaayad

trans.eng: His grief and mourning yield to delight and rapture.

orig.pers: musaafiraan-i iin vaadii agar dar .zaahir bar khaak saakin-and

trans.eng: Although to outward view, the wayfarers in this Valley may dwell upon the dust,

orig.pers: ammaa dar baa.tin bar rafraf-i ma`aanii jaalis

trans.eng: yet inwardly they are throned in the heights of mystic meaning;

orig.pers: va az ni`mat-haa-i bii zavaal ma`navii marzuuq-and

trans.eng: they eat of the endless bounties of inner significances,

orig.pers: va az sharaab-haa-i la.tiif-i ruu.haanii mashruub

trans.eng: and drink of the delicate wines of the spirit.

orig.pers: zabaan dar taf.siil-i iin sih vaadii `aajiz ast va bayaan bi-ghaayat qaa.sir

trans.eng: The tongue faileth in describing these three Valleys, and speech falleth short.

orig.pers: qalam dar iin `ar.sih qadam nagudhaarad va midaad juz savaad thamar nayaarad

trans.eng: The pen steppeth not into this region, the ink leaveth only a blot.

orig.pers: bulbul-i qalb-raa dar iin maqaamaat navaa-haa-i diigar ast va asraar-i diigar

trans.eng: In these planes, the nightingale of the heart hath other songs and secrets,

orig.pers: kih dil az uu bi-juush va ruu.h dar khuruush

trans.eng: which make the heart to stir and the soul to clamor,

orig.pers: va l_akin iin mu`ammaa-i ma`aanii-raa dil bi-dil baayad guft va siinih bi-siinih baayad sipurd

trans.eng: but this mystery of inner meaning may be whispered only from heart to heart, confided only from breast to breast.

poem.line: shar.h-i .haal-i `aarifaan dil bi-dil tavaanad guft
iin nah shiivih-i qaa.sid v iin nah .hadd-i maktuub ast
Only heart to heart can speak the bliss of mystic knowers;
No messenger can tell it and no missive bear it.
vaaskut `ajzaN `an umuuri kathiiraTiN
bi-nu.tqii lan tu.h.sY wa luu qultu qallatiN
I am silent from weakness on many a matter,
For my words could not reckon them and my speech would fall short.

orig.pers: ey rafiiq taa bi-.hadiiqih-i iin ma`aanii narasii az khamr-i baaqii-i iin vaadii nachishii

trans.eng: O friend, till thou enter the garden of such mysteries, thou shalt never set lip to the undying wine of this Valley.

orig.pers: va agar chishii az gheyr chashm puushii va az baadih-i istighnaa binuushii
va az hamih bugsalii va bih uu peyvandii va jaan dar rahash baazii va ravaan raayigaan bar-afshaanii

trans.eng: and thou wilt loose thyself from all things else, and bind thyself to Him, and throw thy life down in His path, and cast thy soul away.

orig.pers: agar chih gheyr-ii dar iin maqaam niist taa chashm puushii kaana al-ll_ahi wa lam yakun mi`ahu min shay'iN

trans.eng: However, there is no other in this region that thou need forget: There was God and there was naught beside Him.

orig.pers: ziiraa kih saalik dar iin rutbih jamaal-i duust-raa dar har shay' biinad

trans.eng: For on this plane the traveler witnesseth the beauty of the Friend in everything.

orig.pers: az naar rukhsaar-i yaar biinad va dar majaaz ramz-i .haqiiqat mulaa.hi.zih kunad va az .sifaat sirr-i huviiyat mushaahidih namaayad

trans.eng: Even in fire, he seeth the face of the Beloved. He beholdeth in illusion the secret of reality, and readeth from the attributes the riddle of the Essence.

orig.pers: ziiraa pardih-haa-raa bi-aahii suukhtih va .hijaab-haa-raa bi-nigaahii bar-daashtih

trans.eng: For he hath burnt away the veils with his sighing, and unwrapped the shroudings with a single glance;

orig.pers: bi-ba.sar-i .hadiid dar .sun`-i jadiid seyr namaayad

trans.eng: with piercing sight he gazeth on the new creation;

orig.pers: va bi-qalb-i raqiiq aathaar-i daqiqq idraak kunad

trans.eng: with lucid heart he graspeth subtle verities.

orig.pers: wa ja`alnaa al-yuum ba.sarika .hadiidaN shaahidi maqaal va kaafii a.hvaal ast

trans.eng: This is sufficiently attested by: And we have made thy sight sharp in this day.

orig.pers: va saalik ba`d az seyr-i maraatib-i istighnaa-i ba.ht dar vaadii-i .heyrat vaa.sil miishavad

trans.eng: After journeying through the planes of pure contentment, the traveler cometh to the Valley of Wonderment

orig.pers: va dar ba.hr-haa-i `a.zamat ghuu.tih miikhwurad va dar har aan bar .heyrat-ash mii-afzaayad

trans.eng: and is tossed in the oceans of grandeur, and at every moment his wonder groweth.

orig.pers: gaah-ii haykal-i ghanaa-raa nafs-i faqr miibiinad va juwhar-i istighnaa-raa .sirf-i `ajz

trans.eng: Now he seeth the shape of wealth as poverty itself, and the essence of freedom as sheer impotence.

orig.pers: gaah-ii ma.hv-i jamaal-i dhuu-al-jalaal miishavad va gaah-ii az vujuud-i khuwd biizaar

trans.eng: Now is he struck dumb with the beauty of the All-Glorious; again is he wearied out with his own life.

orig.pers: iin .sar.sar-i .heyrat chih darakht-haa-i ma`aanii-raa kih az paa andaakht va chih nufuus-haa-raa kih az nafs bar-andaakht

trans.eng: How many a mystic tree hath this whirlwind of wonderment snatched by the roots, how many a soul hath it exhausted.

orig.pers: ziiraa kih iin vaadii saalik-raa dar inqilaab aavarad

trans.eng: For in this Valley the traveler is flung into confusion,

orig.pers: va liikan iin .zuhuuraat dar na.zar-i vaa.sil bisyaar ma.hbuub va marghuub ast

trans.eng: albeit, in the eye of him who hath attained, such marvels are esteemed and well beloved.

orig.pers: va dar har aan `aalam-i badii`-ii va khalq-i jadiid-ii mushaahidih kunad

trans.eng: At every moment he beholdeth a wondrous world, a new creation,

orig.pers: va .heyrat bar .heyrat afzaayad ma.hv-i .sun`-i jadiid-i sul.taan-i a.hadiyyih shavad

trans.eng: and goeth from astonishment to astonishment, and is lost in awe at the works of the Lord of Oneness.

orig.pers: balii ey baraadar agar dar har khalq-ii tafakur namaa'iim

trans.eng: Indeed, O Brother, if we ponder each created thing,

orig.pers: .sad hizaar .hikmat-i baalighih biiniim va .sad hizaar `uluum-i badii`ih bii-aamuuziim

trans.eng: we shall witness a myriad perfect wisdoms and learn a myriad new and wondrous truths.

orig.pers: az jumlih makhluuqaat nuwm ast

trans.eng: One of the created phenomena is the dream. -- jww: jumlih-i?

orig.pers: mulaa.hi.zih kun chiqadr asraar dar uu vadii`ih gudhaastih shudih ast

trans.eng: Behold how many secrets are deposited therein,

orig.pers: va chih .hikmat-haa dar uu makhzuun gashtih ast va chih `avaalim dar uu mastuur maandih

trans.eng: how many wisdoms treasured up, how many worlds concealed.

orig.pers: mulaa.hi.zih farmaa'iid kih shumaa dar bayt-ii miikhwaabiid va dar-haa-i aan bayt bastih ast

trans.eng: Observe, how thou art asleep in a dwelling, and its doors are barred;

orig.pers: yik martabih khuwd-raa dar shahr-i ba`iid-ii mushaahidih miikuniid bii .harikat-i rijl va ta`ab-i jasad bi-aan shahr daakhil miishaviid
va bii za.hmat-i chashm mushaahidih miikuniid va bii mi.hnat-i guush miishinaviid vi bii lisaan takalum miinamaa'iid

trans.eng: without using thine eyes, thou seest; without taxing thine ears, thou hearest; without a tongue, thou speakest.

orig.pers: va gaahast kih aanchih imshab diidih-iid daH saal ba`d dar `aalam-i zamaan bi-.hasab-i .zaahir bi-`eynih aanchih dar khwaab diidih-iid miibiiniid

trans.eng: And perchance when ten years are gone, thou wilt witness in the outer world the very things thou hast dreamed tonight.

orig.pers: .haal chand .hikmat ast kih dar iin nuwm mashhuud ast

trans.eng: Now there are many wisdoms to ponder in the dream,

orig.pers: va gheyr-i ahl-i iin vaadii bar kamaahiya idraak nimiikunand

trans.eng: which none but the people of this Valley can comprehend in their true elements.

orig.pers: avval aankih aan chih `aalam ast kih bii chashm va guush va dast va lisaan .hukm-i hamih iin-haa dar uu ma`muul miishavad

trans.eng: First, what is this world, where without eye and ear and hand and tongue a man puts all of these to use?

orig.pers: va thaanii aankih dar `aalam-i .zuhuur athar-i khwaab-raa imruuz mushaahidih miikunii va liikan iin seyr-raa dar `aalam nuwm dar daH saal qabl diidih'

trans.eng: Second, how is it that in the outer world thou seest today the effect of a dream, when thou didst vision it in the world of sleep some ten years past?

orig.pers: .haal tafakkur namaa farq-i iin do `aalam va asraar-i muwdi`ih-i aan-raa taa bita'yiidaat va mukaashifaat-i sub.haan-ii faa'iz shavii va pey bi-`aalam-i quds barii

trans.eng: Consider the difference between these two worlds and the mysteries which they conceal, that thou mayest attain to divine confirmations and heavenly discoveries and enter the regions of holiness.

orig.pers: va iin aayaat-raa .ha.drat-i baar-ii dar khalq gudhaashtih taa mu.haqqiqiin inkaar-i asraar-i mu`aad nakunand va bi-aanchih va`dih daadih shudih-and sahl nashmurand

trans.eng: God, the Exalted, hath placed these signs in men, to the end that philosophers may not deny the mysteries of the life beyond nor belittle that which hath been promised them.

orig.pers: mithl-i iin-kih ba`.d-ii tamasuk bi-`aql justih va aanchih bi-`aql nayaayad inkaar namaayand

trans.eng: For some hold to reason and deny whatever the reason comprehendeth not,

orig.pers: va .haal aan-kih hargiz `uquul-i .da`iifih hamiin maraatib-i madhkuurih-raa idraak nakunad magar `aql-i kullii-i rabbaanii

trans.eng: and yet weak minds can never grasp the matters which we have related, but only the Supreme, Divine Intelligence can comprehend them:

poem.line: `aql-i juz'ii key tavaanad gasht bar qur'aan mu.hii.t
`ankabuut-ii key tavaanad kard siimurgh-ii shikaar
How can feeble reason encompass the ^qur'aan,
Or the spider snare a phoenix in his web?

orig.pers: va iin `avaalim kull dar vaadii-i .heyrat dast dahad va mushaahidih gardad

trans.eng: All these states are to be witnessed in the Valley of Wonderment,

orig.pers: va saalik dar har aan ziiaadatii .talab namaayad va kasil nashavad

trans.eng: and the traveler at every moment seeketh for more, and is not wearied.

orig.pers: iin-ast kih siyyid-i avvaliin va aakhiriin dar maraatib-i fikrat va i.zhaar-i .heyrat rabbi zidnii fiika ta.hayyuraa farmuudih

trans.eng: Thus the Lord of the First and the Last in setting forth the grades of contemplation, and expressing wonderment hath said: O Lord, increase my astonishment at Thee!

orig.pers: va hamchiniin tafakur dar tamaamiyat-i khalq-i insaan kun

trans.eng: Likewise, reflect upon the perfection of man's creation,

orig.pers: kih iin hamih `avaalim va iin hamih maraatib dar uu mun.tavii va mastuur shudih

trans.eng: and that all these planes and states are folded up and hidden away within him.

poem.line: ata.hsba innika jurmiN .saghiir
wa fiika an.tavY al-`aalama al-akbar
Dost thou reckon thyself only a puny form
When within thee the universe is folded?

orig.pers: pas jahd-ii baayad kih rutbih-i .heyvaanii ma`duum kuniim taa ma`nii-i insaanii .zaahir shavad

trans.eng: Then we must labor to destroy the animal condition, till the meaning of humanity shall come to light.

orig.pers: hamchiniin luqmaan kih az chashmih-i .hikmat nuushiidih va az ba.hr-i ra.hmat chashiidih

trans.eng: Thus, too, ^luqmaan, who had drunk from the wellspring of wisdom and tasted of the waters of mercy,

orig.pers: bi-pisar-ash naataan bi-jahat-i ithbaat-i maqaamaat-i .hashr va muwt hamiin khwaab-raa daliil aavurdih va mathal zadih

trans.eng: in proving to his son Nathan the planes of resurrection and death, advanced the dream as an evidence and an example.

orig.pers: dariin maqaam dhikr miinamaa'iim taa dhikr-ii az aan javaan-i ma.s.tabih-i tuw.hiid va piir-i maraatib-i ta`liim va tajriid az iin bandih-i faanii baaqii bimaanad

trans.eng: We relate it here, that through this evanescent Servant a memory may endure of that youth of the school of Divine Unity, that elder of the art of instruction and the Absolute.

orig.pers: farmuud ey pisar agar qaadir baashii kih nakhwaabii pas qaadir-ii bar aankih namiirii

trans.eng: He said: O Son, if thou art able not to sleep, then thou art able not to die.

orig.pers: va agar bitavaanii ba`d az khwaab biidaar nashavii miitavaanii kih ba`d az marg ma.hshuur nagardii

trans.eng: And if thou art able not to waken after sleep, then thou shalt be able not to rise after death.

orig.pers: ey duust dil kih mu.hall-i asraar-i baaqiyih ast

trans.eng: O friend, the heart is the dwelling of eternal mysteries,

orig.pers: mu.hall-i afkaar-i faanyih makun va sarmaayih-i `umr-i giraan-maayih-raa bi-ishtighaal-i dunyaa-i faanyih az dast madih

trans.eng: make it not the home of fleeting fancies; waste not the treasure of thy precious life in employment with this swiftly passing world.

orig.pers: az `aalam-i qudsii bi-turaab dil maband

trans.eng: Thou comest from the world of holinessbind not thine heart to the earth;

orig.pers: va ahl-i basaa.t-i uns-ii va.tan-i khaakii mapasand

trans.eng: thou art a dweller in the court of nearnesschoose not the homeland of the dust.

orig.pers: baar-ii dhikr-i iin maraatib-raa intihaa'ii nah

trans.eng: In sum, there is no end to the description of these stages,

orig.pers: va iin bandih-raa az .sadamih-i ahl-i ruuz-i gaar a.hvaal-ii nah

trans.eng: but because of the wrongs inflicted by the peoples of the earth, this Servant is in no mood to continue:

poem.line: iin sukhan naaqi.s bimaand va bii-qaraar
dil nadaaram bii-dilam ma`dhuur daar
The tale is still unfinished and I have no heart for it
Then pray forgive me.
