orig.pers: qalam naalih miikunad va midaad miigiryad va jey.huun-i dil khuun muwj miizanad

trans.eng: The pen groaneth and the ink sheddeth tears, and the river of the heart moveth in waves of blood.

arab.quote: lan yu.siibanaa ilaa maakitaba al-ll_ahi lanaa

eng.quote: Nothing can befall us but what God hath destined for us.

orig.arab: wa as-salaamu `alY man ittaba`a al-hudY

trans.eng: Peace be upon him who followeth the Right Path!

orig.pers: va saalik ba`d az irtiqaa-i bi-maraatib-i buland-i .heyrat bi-vaadii-i faqr-i .haqiiqii va fanaa-i a.slii vaarid shavad

trans.eng: After scaling the high summits of wonderment the wayfarer cometh to the Valley of True Poverty and Absolute Nothingness.

orig.pers: va iin rutbih maqaam-i fanaa-i az nafs va baqaa-i bi-al-ll_ah ast

trans.eng: This station is the dying from self and the living in God,

orig.pers: va faqr az khuwd va ghanaa-i bi-maq.suud ast

trans.eng: the being poor in self and rich in the Desired One.

orig.pers: va dar iin maqaam kih dhikr-i faqr miishavad ya`nii faqiir ast az aanchih dar `aalam-i khalq ast va ghanii ast bi-aanchih dar `avaalim-i .haq ast

trans.eng: Poverty as here referred to signifieth being poor in the things of the created world, rich in the things of God's world.

orig.pers: ziiraa kih `aashiq-i .saadiq va .habiib-i muvaafiq chuun biliqaa-i ma.hbuub va ma`shuuq rasiid

trans.eng: For when the true lover and devoted friend reacheth to the presence of the Beloved,

orig.pers: az partuwi jamaal-i ma.hbuub va aatish-i qalb-i .habiib naar-ii mushta`il shavad va jamii`-i saraadiqaat va .hujubaat raa bisuuzaanad

trans.eng: the sparkling beauty of the Loved One and the fire of the lover's heart will kindle a blaze and burn away all veils and wrappings.

orig.pers: balkih aanchih baa uu ast .hattY maghz va puust mu.htariq gardad va juz duust chiiz-ii namaanad

trans.eng: Yea, all he hath, from heart to skin, will be set aflame, so that nothing will remain save the Friend.

poem.line: chuun tajallii kard uw.saaf-i qadiim
pas bisuuzad va.sf-i .haadith-raa kaliim
When the qualities of the Ancient of Days stood revealed,
Then the qualities of earthly things did Moses burn away.

orig.pers: va dar iin maqaam vaa.sil muqaddas ast az aanchih muta`alliq bi-dunyaa-st

trans.eng: He who hath attained this station is sanctified from all that pertaineth to the world.

orig.pers: pas agar dar nazd-i vaa.siliin-i ba.hr-i vi.saal az ashyaa'i ma.hduudih kih muta`alliq bi-`aalam-i faanii ast yaaft nashavad

trans.eng: Wherefore, if those who have come to the sea of His presence are found to possess none of the limited things of this perishable world,

orig.pers: chih az amvaal-i .zaahiriyyih baashad va chih az tafakkuraat-i nafsiyyih ba's-ii niist

trans.eng: whether it be outer wealth or personal opinions, it mattereth not.

orig.pers: ziiraa kih aanchih nazd-i khalq ast ma.hduud ast bi-.haduud-i iishaan va aanchih nazd-i .haq ast muqaddas az aan
iin bayaan-raa bisyaar fikr baayad taa paayaan aashkaar shavad

trans.eng: this utterance must be deeply pondered that its purport may be clear.

arab.quote: inna al-abraar yashribuuna min ka'si kaana mizaajihaa kaafuuraa

eng.quote: Verily the righteous shall drink of a winecup tempered at the camphor fountain.

orig.pers: agar ma`nii-i kaafuur ma`luum shavad maq.suud-i .haqiiqii ma`luum gardad

trans.eng: If the interpretation of camphor become known, the true intention will be evident.

orig.pers: iin maqaam az faqr ast kih miifarmaayad al-faqru fakhrii

trans.eng: This state is that poverty of which it is said, Poverty is My glory.

orig.pers: va az baraa-i faqr-i baa.tinii va .zaahirii maraatib-haa va ma`nii-haa ast kih dhikr aan-raa munaasib-i iin maqaam nadiidam
lih_adhaa bi-`uhdih-i vaqt-ii gudhaashtam taa khudaa chih khwaahad va qa.daa chih im.daa namaayad

trans.eng: hence I have reserved these for another time, dependent on what God may desire and fate may seal.

orig.pers: va iin maqaam ast kih katharaat-i kull-i shay' dar saalik haalik shavad

trans.eng: This is the plane whereon the vestiges of all things are destroyed in the traveler,

orig.pers: va .tal`at-i vajh az mashriq-i baqaa sar az ghi.taa biiruun aavarad

trans.eng: and on the horizon of eternity the Divine Face riseth out of the darkness,

orig.pers: va ma`nii-i kulli shay'iN haalak illaa wajhihu mashhuud gardad

trans.eng: and the meaning of All on the earth shall pass away, but the face of thy Lord... is made manifest.

orig.pers: ey .habiib-i man naghamaat-i ruu.h-raa bi-jaan va dil guush kun va chuun ba.sar .hif.z-ash namaa

trans.eng: O My friend, listen with heart and soul to the songs of the spirit, and treasure them as thine own eyes.

orig.pers: kih hamiishih-i ayyaam ma`aarif-i il_ahii bi-mathaabih abr-i neysaanii bar araa.dii-i quluub-i insaanii jaarii niist

trans.eng: For the heavenly wisdoms, like the clouds of spring, will not rain down on the earth of men's hearts forever;

orig.pers: agar chih fey.d-i fayyaa.d-raa ta`.tiil-ii va ta`viiq-ii nah

trans.eng: and though the grace of the All-Bounteous One is never stilled and never ceasing,

orig.pers: va l_akin har zamaan va `a.sr-raa rizq-ii ma`luum va ni`mat-ii muqaddar ast va bi-qadr va andaazih ifaa.dih miishavad

trans.eng: yet to each time and era a portion is allotted and a bounty set apart, this in a given measure.

arab.quote: wa in min shay'iN illaa `indanaa khazaa i'nahu wa maa nazzalahu illaa biqadriN ma`luum

eng.quote: And no one thing is there, but with Us are its storehouses; and We send it not down but in settled measure.

orig.pers: sa.haab-i ra.hmat-i jaanaan juz bar riiaa.d-i jaan nabaarad va dar gheyr-i bahaar-aan iin karam nafarmaayad

trans.eng: The cloud of the Loved One's mercy raineth only on the garden of the spirit, and bestoweth this bounty only in the season of spring.

orig.pers: fu.suul diigar-raa az iin fa.dl-i akbar na.siib-ii niist va araa.dii-i jarzih-raa az iin karam qismat-ii nah

trans.eng: The other seasons have no share in this greatest grace, and barren lands no portion of this favor.

orig.pers: ey baraadar har ba.hr-ii lu'lu' nadaarad va har shaakh-ii gul nayaarad va bulbul bar aan nasaraayad

trans.eng: O Brother! Not every sea hath pearls; not every branch will flower, nor will the nightingale sing thereon.

orig.pers: pas taa bulbul-i buustaan-i ma`navii bi-gulistaan-i il_ahii baaz nagasht

trans.eng: Then, ere the nightingale of the mystic paradise repair to the garden of God,

orig.pers: va anvaar-i .sub.h-i ma`aanii bi-shams-i .haqiiqii raaji` nashud

trans.eng: and the rays of the heavenly morning return to the Sun of Truth

orig.pers: sa`ii kuniid kih shaayad dar iin gulkhan-i faanii buu'ii az gulshin-i baaqii bishnaviid

trans.eng: make thou an effort, that haply in this dustheap of the mortal world thou mayest catch a fragrance from the everlasting garden,

orig.pers: va dar .zil-i ahl-i iin madiinih-i jaaviid bimaaniid

trans.eng: and live forever in the shadow of the peoples of this city.

orig.pers: va chuun bi-iin rutbih-i buland-i a`lY rasiidii va bi-iin darajih-i `u.zmY faa'iz shudii

trans.eng: And when thou hast attained this highest station and come to this mightiest plane,

orig.pers: yaar biinii va aghyaar faraamuush kunii

trans.eng: then shalt thou gaze on the Beloved, and forget all else.

poem.line: yaar bii-pardih az dar o diivaar
dar tajallii-ast yaa uulii al-ab.saar
The Beloved shineth on gate and wall
Without a veil, O men of vision.

orig.pers: az qa.trih-i jaan gudhashtii va bi-ba.hr-i jaanaan vaa.sil shudii

trans.eng: Now hast thou abandoned the drop of life and come to the sea of the Life-Bestower.

orig.pers: iin-ast maq.suud-ii kih .talab farmuudii inshaa al-ll_ah bi-aan faa'iz shavii

trans.eng: This is the goal thou didst ask for; if it be God's will, thou wilt gain it.

orig.pers: dar iin madiinih .hujibaat-i nuur ham kharq miishavad va zaa'il miigardad

trans.eng: In this city, even the veils of light are split asunder and vanish away.

arab.quote: laa lijamaalihu .hijaabiN savY an-nuur wa laa livajhihi niqaabiN illaa a.z-.zuhuur

eng.quote: His beauty hath no veiling save light, His face no covering save revelation.

orig.pers: ey `ajab kih yaar chuun shams aashkaar va aghyaar dar .talab-i zakhaaruf va diinaar

trans.eng: How strange that while the Beloved is visible as the sun, yet the heedless still hunt after tinsel and base metal.

orig.pers: balii az shiddat-i .zuhuur pinhaan maandih va az kithrat buruuz makhfii gashtih

trans.eng: Yea, the intensity of His revelation hath covered Him, and the fullness of His shining forth hath hidden Him.

poem.line: .haq `ayaan chuun mihr-i rakhshaan aamadih
.heyf kandar shahr-i kuuraan aamadih
Even as the sun, bright hath He shined,
But alas, He hath come to the town of the blind!

orig.pers: dar iin vaadii saalik maraatib-i va.hdat-i vujuud va shuhuud-raa .tey namaayad

trans.eng: In this Valley, the wayfarer leaveth behind him the stages of the oneness of Being and Manifestation

orig.pers: va bi-va.hdat-ii kih muqaddas az iin do maqaam ast vaa.sil gardad

trans.eng: and reacheth a oneness that is sanctified above these two stations.

orig.pers: a.hvaal pey bi-iin maqaal barad nah bayaan va jidaal

trans.eng: Ecstasy alone can encompass this theme, not utterance nor argument;

orig.pers: va har kas dar-iin ma.hfil manzil guziidih va yaa az iin riiaa.d nasiim-ii yaaftih miidaanad chih `ar.d miishavad

trans.eng: and whosoever hath dwelt at this stage of the journey, or caught a breath from this garden land, knoweth whereof We speak.

orig.pers: va saalik baayad dar jamii`-i iin asfaar bi-qadr-i sha`r-ii az sharii`at kih fii al-.haqiiqih sirr-i .tariiqat va thamarih-i shajrih-i .haqiiqat ast in.hiraaf navarzad

trans.eng: In all these journeys the traveler must stray not the breadth of a hair from the Law, for this is indeed the secret of the Path and the fruit of the Tree of Truth;

orig.pers: va dar hamih-i maraatib bidheyl-i i.taa`at-i avaamir mutashabbith baashad

trans.eng: and in all these stages he must cling to the robe of obedience to the commandments,

orig.pers: va bi-.habl-i i`raa.d az manaahii mutamassik taa az ka's-i sharii`at marzuuq shavad va bar asraar-i .haqiiqat vaaqif gardad

trans.eng: and hold fast to the cord of shunning all forbidden things, that he may be nourished from the cup of the Law and informed of the mysteries of Truth.

orig.pers: va har chih az bayaanaat-i iin bandih mafhuum nashavad va tazalzul-ii i.hdaath kunad baayad mujaddad su'aal shavad taa shubhih namaanad

trans.eng: If any of the utterances of this Servant may not be comprehended, or may lead to perturbation, the same must be inquired of again, that no doubt may linger,

orig.pers: va maq.suud chuun .tal`at-i ma.hbuub az maqaam-i ma.hmuud .zaahir gardad

trans.eng: and the meaning be clear as the Face of the Beloved One shining from the Glorious Station.

orig.pers: va iin asfaar kih aan-raa dar `aalam-i zamaan intihaa'ii padiid niist

trans.eng: These journeys have no visible ending in the world of time,

orig.pers: saalik-i munqa.ti`-raa agar i`aanat-i gheybii birasad va valii-i amr madad farmaayad

trans.eng: but the severed wayfarerif invisible confirmation descend upon him and the Guardian of the Cause assist him

orig.pers: iin haft rutbih-raa dar haft qadam .tey namaayad balkih dar haft nafas balkih dar yik nafas idhaa shaa' al-ll_aha

trans.eng: may cross these seven stages in seven steps, nay rather in seven breaths, nay rather in a single breath, if God will and desire it.

orig.arab: wa araada wadh_alika min fa.dlihi `alY man yashaa'

trans.eng: And this is of His grace on such of His servants as He pleaseth.

orig.pers: .taayiraan-i havaa-i tuw.hiid va vaa.silaan-i lujjih-i tajriid iin maqaam-raa kih maqaam-i baqaa' bi-al-ll_ah ast

trans.eng: They who soar in the heaven of singleness and reach to the sea of the Absolute, reckon this city which is the station of life in God

orig.pers: dar iin madiinih muntahY rutbih-i `aarifaan va muntahY va.tan-i `aashiqaan shumurdih-and

trans.eng: as the furthermost state of mystic knowers, and the farthest homeland of the lovers.

orig.pers: va nazd-i iin faanii ba.hr-i ma`nii-i iin maqaam avval shahr band-i dil ast

trans.eng: But to this evanescent One of the mystic ocean, this station is the first gate of the heart's citadel,

orig.pers: ya`anii avval varuud-i insaan ast bi-madiinih-i qalb

trans.eng: that is, man's first entrance to the city of the heart;

orig.pers: va qalb-raa chihaar rutbih muqarrar ast

trans.eng: and the heart is endowed with four stages

orig.pers: agar ahl-ash yaaft shud madhkuur aayad

trans.eng: which would be recounted should a kindred soul be found.

poem.line: chuun qalam dar va.sf-i iin .haalat rasiid
ham qalam bi-shikast o ham kaaghadh dariid
When the pen set to picturing this station,
It broke in pieces and the page was torn.

orig.arab: wa as-salaam

trans.eng: ^salaam!

orig.pers: ey .habiib-i man iin ghazaal-i .sa.hraa-i a.hadiyyih-raa kalaab-ii chand dar pey

trans.eng: O My friend! Many a hound pursueth this gazelle of the desert of oneness;

orig.pers: va iin bulbul-i bustaan-i .samadiyyih-raa manqaar-ii chand dar ta`aaqub

trans.eng: many a talon claweth at this thrush of the eternal garden.

orig.pers: va iin .taayir-i havaa-i il_ahii-raa ghuraab-i kiin dar kamiin va iin .seyd-i barr-i `ishq-raa .sayyaad-i .hasad dar `aqab

trans.eng: Pitiless ravens do lie in wait for this bird of the heavens of God, and the huntsman of envy stalketh this deer of the meadow of love.

orig.pers: ey sheykh himat-raa zujaaj kun kih shaayad iin siraaj-raa az baad-haa-i mukhaalif .hif.z namaayad
agar chih iin siraaj-raa umiid chinaan ast kih dar zujaajih-i il_ahii mushta`il gardad va dar mushkuuT-i ma`navii bar-afruuzad

trans.eng: albeit this light doth long to be kindled in the lamp of the Lord, and to shine in the globe of the spirit.

orig.pers: ziiraa gardan-ii kih bi-`ishq-i il_ahii buland shud albatih bi-shamshiir uftad

trans.eng: For the head raised up in the love of God will certainly fall by the sword,

orig.pers: va sar-ii kih bi-.hubb bar-afraakht albattih bi-baad ravad

trans.eng: and the life that is kindled with longing will surely be sacrificed,

orig.pers: va qalb-ii kih bi-dhikr ma.hbuub peyvast albattih pur khuun gardad

trans.eng: and the heart which remembereth the Loved One will surely brim with blood.

orig.arab: fana`am maa qaal

trans.eng: How well is it said:

poem.line: wa`ash khaaliyaN fa-al-.hubbi raa.hataN `anaa
fa-avvalahu suqmiN wa aakhirihu' qatliN
Live free of love, for its very peace is anguish;
Its beginning is pain, its end is death.

orig.arab: wa as-salaamu `alY man ittaba`a al-hudY

trans.eng: Peace be upon him who followeth the Right Path!

orig.pers: aanchih az badaayi`-i fikr dar ma`nii-i .tayr-i ma`ruuf kih bi-faarsii gunjishk miinaamand dhikr farmuudand ma`luum va mu.haqqaq shud

trans.eng: The thoughts thou hast expressed as to the interpretation of the common species of bird that is called in Persian ^gunjishk (sparrow) were considered.

orig.pers: guuyaa bar asraar-i ma`aanii vaaqif shudih-and

trans.eng: Thou appearest to be well-grounded in mystic truth.

orig.pers: va l_akin har .harf-ii-raa dar har `aalam-ii bi-iqti.daa-i aan maq.suud-ii muqarrar ast

trans.eng: However, on every plane, to every letter a meaning is allotted which relateth to that plane.

orig.pers: balii saalikiin az har ism-ii ramz-ii va az har .harf-ii sirr-ii idraak miinamaayand

trans.eng: Indeed, the wayfarer findeth a secret in every name, a mystery in every letter.

orig.pers: va iin .huruufaat dar maqaam-ii ishaarih bi-taqdiis ast

trans.eng: In one sense, these letters refer to holiness.

orig.arab: k ay kaffa nafsika `ammaa yashtahiihu huwa 'aka thumma aqbil ilY muwl_a'ika

trans.eng: ^kaaf or ^gaaf (K or G) referreth to ^kuffih (free), that is, Free thyself from that which thy passion desireth; then advance unto thy Lord.

orig.arab: n nazih nafsika `ammaa sava'ih litafdiya bi-ruu.hika fii hava'ih

trans.eng: ^nuun referreth to ^nazzih (purify), that is, Purify thyself from all else save Him, that thou mayest surrender thy life in His love.

orig.arab: j jaanibi jinaabu al-.haqq in baqiya fiika min .sifaati al-khalq

trans.eng: ^jiim is ^jaanib (draw back), that is, Draw back from the threshold of the True One if thou still possessest earthly attributes.

orig.arab: sh ashkur rabbika fii ar.dihu liyashkurika fii samaa'ihu wa in kaanati as-samaa' fii `aalamu al-a.hadiyyih nafsi ar.dahu

trans.eng: ^shiin is ^ashkur (thank)Thank thy Lord on His earth that He may bless thee in His heaven; albeit in the world of oneness, this heaven is the same as His earth.

orig.arab: k kaffir `anka al-.hujibaati al-ma.hduudaTi lita`rifa maalaa `araftahu min al-maqaamaati al-qudsiyyaTi wa inaka luwtasma`a naghamaat

trans.eng: ^kaaf referreth to ^kaffir, that is: Take off from thyself the wrappings of limitations, that thou mayest come to know what thou hast not known of the states of Sanctity.

orig.arab: h_adhahi a.t-.teyri al-faaniyaT lita.tluba min al-ku'usi al-baaqiyyaTi ad-daa'imaT wa tatraka al-ku'ubi al-faaniyyaTi az-zaa'ilaT

trans.eng: Wert thou to harken to the melodies of this mortal Bird, then wouldst thou seek out the undying chalice and pass by every perishable cup.

orig.arab: wa as-salaamu `alY man ittaba`a al-hudY

trans.eng: Peace be upon those who walk in the Right Path!
